title: Leetspeak - Beyond the Framework
subTitle: Conference
description: Venue changed to Sankt Gertrud at Östergatan 7b, Malmö. It's still close to Malmö C train station. tretton37 unveils its first ever day long conference open to the public, featuring 6 impressive speakers and 6 illuminating sessions. Leetspeak is a conference born out of the desire to bring hardcore technical and inspiring content to those who need to know. Launched this year by the fast growing knowledge based firm, tretton37, it’s an event that is aimed at developers who are excited to stay at the forefront of the knowledge game, with a spotlight on the .NET developer who knows there’s honey to be had beyond the domain framework. Community is a cornerstone of the tretton37 mentality and Leetspeak is one way in which the organization is reaching out to to fellow developers who want to connect and learn from one another in the region and beyond. Since its inception, the company has hosted regular in-house evening seminars. As tretton37 is dedicated to promoting a mindful ecosystem within the .NET domain, the next natural step in the firm’s evolution is to create an event open to the community it is naturally connected with. And to push things just a little bit further… because often the best kind of learning occurs when we step outside of our domain and comfort zone. 08:00 – 08:30 – Breakfast Enjoy a strengthening meal to prepare for a full day of learning 08:30 – 08:45 – Introduction A short introcution before we kick off 08:45 – 09:45 – Hadi Hariri Developers: The Prima Donnas of the 21st Century 10:00 – 11:00 – Gary Short Asymptotics and Algorithms – What You’ve Forgotten Since University 11:15 – 12:15 – Rob Ashton Building and testing full-stack node apps 12:15 – 13:00 – Lunch Food to keep us going 13:00 – 14:00 – Martin Mazur Why you should talk to strangers 14:15 – 15:15 – Mark Rendle Hidden Complexity: Inside Simple.Data and Simple.Web 15:15 – 15:30 – Panic food Refreshments 15:30 – 16:30 – Jon McCoy Hacking .NET Applications: God Mode 16:45 – 17:45 – Enrico Campidoglio Grokking Git by seeing it Leetspeak is SOLD OUT Please send an email to leetspeak@tretton37.com if you would like to be on the waiting list.

title: Special guest speaker Dan North
subTitle: GRAND OPENING
description: A very special evening! After testing the Foo Café concept from the Lean Opening (March 22nd) we have now reach the point where we are fully prepared to say LET'S GO! The Foo Café Grand Opening will be our start for the first meeting place that is like a conference but everyday, year round. We aren't copying anyone we are creating something that has never been tried before and you will be part of it. Our highlight this evening is Dan North, a reknowed Keynote speaker from major conferences. Dan has written a special speech for this evening; Deliberate Learning: the reason for Foo Café Some programmers look at programming as more than their day job. They want to deepen their understanding, develop skills and learn techniques that will make them better programmers. Many invest their time outside of work or college in coding dojos practising "code katas" where they learn to fluently solve a Tower of Hanoi problem in Ruby or a Harry Potter book store problem in Python. I admire their dedication but I'm not convinced this is the best approach to making anyone a better programmer. The metaphor of dojos and katas for improving programming skills is misleading. Learning martial arts - and musical scales for that matter - is about deliberate practise whereas programming skills are developed through deliberate learning. In he former, you aspire to flawlessly reproduce a given sequence of moves or perform a piece of music. You want to perform the perfect ippon seo nage or play Rachmaninoff's 3rd Symphony without a single error. Deliberate learning on the other hand is about developing discovery and problem-solving skills in unfamiliar contexts. In this talk Dan argues the case for deliberate learning with some techniques for improving your programming, and explains why Foo Café is such an important idea. Dan North uses his deep technical and organisational knowledge to help CIOs, business and software teams to deliver quickly and successfully. He puts people first and finds simple, pragmatic solutions to business and technical problems, often using lean and agile techniques. He believes most technology problems are really about communication and feedback, which explains his interest in organisational design, systems thinking and how people learn. He has been consulting, coding and coaching for over 20 years, and he occasionally blogs at http://dannorth.net. After Dan's speech will we have some suprises, so I hope you will stay around to experience it. Welcome!

title: Learn more
subTitle: Events
description: Master Class at Foo Café One or two days workshops (or courses) are called "Master Class" at Foo Café. The concept provides the attendee with the best tutors in their field, ie; masters. Classes are normally only offered at high level conferences. Through our network we are able to attract the best on your behalf. Registration terms and conditions Events that don't have a listed price are free to attend. All Master Classes have a fixed price for each event. All prices are excluding VAT. Swedish VAT will be added to the invoice. There are a limited number of seats to secure best value for you. Lunch, coffee/tea and documentation is included at every Master Class. The Master Class will take place as scheduled when at least four attendees have signed up. Foo Café will invoice you as soon as we have reached the baseline number of registered attendees. If you are prevented from attending, attendee must notify Foo Café before the class starts. A registrant may transfer enrollment to another attendee or apply it to another Master Class. You will be given a voucher that has the invoiced value - which can be put forward to any Foo Café Master Class. There are no refunds once enrolled.

title: Faster Software Delivery: from months to minutes - Dan North
subTitle: Master Class
description:
You've made the shift to sprints or iterations, you have an automated build pipeline, you practise TDD religiously and rotate pairs like clockwork. Your automated acceptance tests are a thing of beauty, your integration build takes less than an hour and you release into production every month. In fact you couldn't be any more Agile. So is this as good as it gets? Over the past two years Dan has been working with teams that deliver in days rather than months, and iterate in hours rather than weeks. These teams don't just break all the rules, they make up new ones of their own. Dan has been observing and collecting these unusual and counter-intuitive techniques and calling them Patterns of Effective Delivery. 

On this course you will learn a new approach to agile development, automation and team dynamics that teaches you to think about them differently. By exploring several architecture and development patterns in detail Dan shows how you and your teams can produce and deploy software faster than they thought possible. You'll never look at TDD the same way again, not to mention copying-and-pasting code. 

Dan North uses his deep technical and organisational knowledge to help CIOs, business and software teams to deliver quickly and successfully. He puts people first and finds simple, pragmatic solutions to business and technical problems, often using lean and agile techniques. He believes most technology problems are really about communication and feedback, which explains his interest in organisational design, systems thinking and how people learn. He has been consulting, coding and coaching for over 20 years, and he occasionally blogs at http://dannorth.net. 

The course includes documentation, coffee/tea and lunch

title: Want to be a better Speaker?
subTitle: Malmö Toastmasters
description: What is Toastmasters? Toastmasters is an international organization with over 250,000 members worldwide consisting of almost 13,000 clubs in 106 countries. Since 2010, Malmö has had a Toastmasters club of its own, with meetings in English. What Does Toastmasters Do? Well, we have nothing to do with roasting bread or breakfast. Instead Toastmasters has grown to become a world leader in helping people become more competent and comfortable in front of an audience. Communications, public speaking and leadership skills can all be found in abundance at your normal Toastmasters meeting. Why Toastmasters? If you are in a position where you need to communicate, and who of us isn’t, Toastmasters can help. The self paced program, the members, and the global organization provide all the support you need to achieve whatever goal it is you have at a fraction of the cost of a normal one day communications course. From engineers to entertainers, government workers to entrepreneurs, Toastmasters members represent a wide range of people who are committed to working towards a common goal in a supportive, professional atmosphere. Plus, we are a lot of fun! Sounds Great! How do I get started? Of course it does! If you would like more information please check out our website at www.malmo.toastmasters.se or e-mail us at malmo@toastmasters.se. As a member organization, guests are always welcome to take a test drive before jumping in to what could be one of the most rewarding decisions you have ever made. Hope to see you soon at a Malmö Toastmasters meeting!

title: CasparCG - Ett fritt och öppet video och grafik system
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: CasparCG (www.casparcg.org) är ett professionellt, fritt och öppet video och grafik system för bland annat TV sändningar, evenemang och digital skyltning. CasparCG är en mogen lösning som bevisats dygnet runt i sändningar hos flera olika användare sedan 2006. En av de största användarna av systemet är Sveriges Television (SVT) som använder CasparCG för all grafik i regionala och nationella sändningar sedan 2010. Ni kommer att få en introduktion av CasparCG samt ge en praktisk demonstration av CasparCG och dess funktioner. Detta frukostseminarie är för Er som är intresserade av en kraftfull och kostnadseffektiv video och grafik lösning. Presentatören Robert Nagy har arbetat som huvudutvecklare av den senaste versionen av systemet, CasparCG 2.0. Robert arbetade tidigare hos SVT och har under fem år arbetat med CasparCG och relaterade projekt. Robert lämnade nyligen SVT för att börja på Redpatch och därmed stödja företagets satsning på att hjälpa kunder med tjänster kring CasparCG. Vi inleder med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00 - presentationen startar 08.00 och pågår till 09.00

title: Android & iOS, an introduction for the app-curios
subTitle: Geek Girl Meetup
description: Geek Girl Meetup Öresund is a network for geek girls interested in web, technology and innovation. Apps are everywhere, and even if they aim to be magically simple and delightful to use the approach for creating them is quite mundane. We will guide you through the first setup, show the resources you need and explain the differences between Android and iPhone apps. You will see a basic app being created as well as some show-off stuff. Then we add in some talk about making a business of it and reaching the users. We're proud of the Speakers for this Geek Girl Meetup event. Ester Ytterbrink is a full time geek. Her professional geekdom is programming and software engineering in general, but with a focus on Cocoa Touch and ObjC in the iOS team at Jayway. She thinks that everything gets more fun by being taken serious, so her geekiness shows in almost all aspects of her life. Apple, and their products, has been a part of her daily life since 1989 and her iPhone has almost turned into an extension of her body. Jenny Håkansson is a software engineer at Jayway working with Android development at Sony Mobile. She is passionate about the mobile industry, especially about Android, and find it exciting to follow and be part of the rapid development of smart phones. Tina Pulko is an entrepreneur involved in a technology startup InvivoPlay, where a unique combination of technology, fun and positive psychology is used to encourage and spread positive behaviors and emotions in the society. She has a special interest in marketing strategy and marketing communications, and experience as a marketing consultant from various industries (IT, consumer goods, entertainment, non profit, tourism) and markets (Sweden, Canada, Slovenia). Please note that this is an evening for Girls (only)

title: Presentation av det nya standardavtalet för agila projekt
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Det nya avtalet är tänkt att användas när parterna gemensamt önskar arbeta enligt ett agilt arbetssätt, vilket innebär att parterna i samverkan bedriver projektarbetet och där arbetsresultatet stegvis växer fram utan att man i förväg behövt göra en omfattande kravspecifikation. Välkommen till ett informationsmöte där vi diskuterar det nya avtalet och även hur/om detta kan användas i offshorade projekt. Lars Wendestam från Logica initierade arbetet med det nya avtalet hos IT & telekomföretagen och har deltagit i det arbetsutskott som arbetet fram det nya avtalet och presenterar resultatet. Agenda: - Kaffe och smörgås. - Presentation av avtalsdokumenten. - Bakgrund till IT-företagens avtalsportfölj - Bakgrund om agila metoder relaterat agile contracting - Hur det nya ”Allmänna bestämmelser för Agila projekt” är tänkt att användas - Struktur och bakgrund i avtalet - Utblickar mot vad man gör i övriga Norden gällande agile contracting - Hur kan offshorade projekt dra nytta av detta? - Diskussion Välkommen till en givande afton! Registrera dig här

title: A Question of Craftsmanship
subTitle: Kevlin Henney
description: Although a great deal of the enthusiasm for Agile development initially grew from software developers, the perception is that much of the current focus in Agile circles has moved to organisational aspects, product management and soft skills. Craftsmanship has long been a quality and a metaphor applied to software development, but more recently software craftsmanship has emerged as a more explicit movement and branding focused on reclaiming and re-emphasising the importance of the detail, of how to code and how to do it well. There are many different perspectives on what the craftsmanship metaphor implies and what benefits and liabilities it may have. This session lays out and explores the motivation, implications, pros and cons of a craftsmanship view of software development. Kevlin Henney is an independent consultant and trainer. His development interests are in patterns, programming, practice and process. He has been a columnist for various magazines and web sites, including Better Software, The Register, Application Development Advisor, Java Report and the C/C++ Users Journal. Kevlin is co-author of A Pattern Language for Distributed Computing and On Patterns and Pattern Languages, two volumes in the Pattern-Oriented Software Architecture series. He is also editor of the 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know site and book.

title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know - Kevlin Henney
subTitle: Master Class
description: Modern programmers have a lot on their minds. Programming languages, programming techniques, development environments, tools, development process, deadlines, meetings, software architecture, design patterns, team dynamics, code, requirements, bugs, code quality. And more. A lot. The 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know project collected together the wisdom of many contributors to offer a distilled snapshot of what every programmer should know. This one-day course draws from this collection to present some highlights and useful advice. Kevlin Henney is an independent consultant and trainer. His development interests are in patterns, programming, practice and process. He has been a columnist for various magazines and web sites, including Better Software, The Register, Application Development Advisor, Java Report and the C/C++ Users Journal. Kevlin is co-author of A Pattern Language for Distributed Computing and On Patterns and Pattern Languages, two volumes in the Pattern-Oriented Software Architecture series. He is also editor of the 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know site and book. The course includes documentation, coffee/tea and lunch

title: .NET Best Practices
subTitle: Konferens
description: Heldagskonferens Erfarna utvecklare delar under dagen med sig av praktiska råd, verktyg, och tekniker för att bemästra .NET på allra bästa sätt. Agenda 08:00-08:30 Registrering och frukost 08:30-09:15 How Functional Programming Influences My C# - Jonathan Worthington C# in 2012 is a multi-paradigm language. While its OO roots are still clear to see, many of the more recent additions to the language have been inspired by functional programming. But what is FP anyway? Taken in its purest form, functional programming presents a wildly different approach to software development than many of us are used to. While imperative programming sees us writing programs that perform a series of steps that mutate variables and objects along the way, FP defines programs through a function applications and puts the focus firmly on immutable data structures. In this talk, I'll start by taking a look at the C# language features that have been inspired by functional programming: lambda expressions and LINQ. However, that's only one part of the story; the influence of functional programming on my C# development goes deeper than just using certain language features. I'll discuss some of the ways this influence plays out in the code I write, and why you might want to do similar in your own development. 09:15-10:00 Death to the batch job - Andreas Öhlund When most developers are tasked to implement time-bound business requrements the de facto solution is to create the dreaded batch job. While a batch job might solve the immediate problem their brute force nature makes them resource intensive and forces us to run them at night when the system is under less load. But what if we run global operations that puts constant load on our system? What if that window of time is to short to get all work done? When everything is getting more and more "real time" we need to run our jobs more often. But how often can we really run them given the load they put on our database? Join Andreas for some real-time solutions to time-bound processes with the latest and greatest sagas from NServiceBus that will help you keep your events small and fit for the purpose thus mitigating the problems above. Kaffepaus 10:00-10:15 10:15-11:00 Command-Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) explained - Andreas Öhlund Command-Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) can help you come up with a more appropriate architecture for multi-user collaborative enterprise applications. We learn how exploit factors like data staleness and volatility to create simpler and more scalable constructs. We will also see how CQRS is a key enabler for both Domain Driven Design and ultimately storing your business data using Event Sourcing. 11:00-11:45 Web API and REST - Eric Lavesson The MVC4 RC has been released, and Web API is perhaps the most exciting addition. Web API brings us new ways to build web services, especially RESTful services. But what constitutes a RESTful service? The idea of REST has been around for some time, and writing services in this manner has been possible before Web API. So what functionality does the new ASP.NET Web API framework offer? And how does it compare to other web service frameworks on the .Net platform, such as WCF? In this talk, I’ll look at what REST is and how to implement a simple service using ASP.NET Web API. Lunch 11:45-12:45 12:45-13:30 Reliable integrations with NServiceBus - Andreas Öhlund In this talk, Andreas Öhlund will discuss how developers use NServiceBus in the core parts of their systems for the reliability it brings, but aren't aware that it can also help with integration as well. Further to this, Andreas will show how the saga capabilities in NServiceBus make integration code simpler, more robust, and testable. 13:30-14:15 Async Programming Awaits You - Jonathan Worthington C# has come a long way since the first version arrived. Now version 5 of the language is around the corner, and its focus is on asynchronous programming. Traditionally, asynchronous programming has been fiddly enough to keep many developers from doing it widely. At the same time, the need for it has quietly crept up on us. Users demand ever more responsive applications, calling out to web services has become the norm and the multi-core world is pushing us to do more work in parallel, which of course we have to manage and synchronize somehow. Asynchronous programming is applicable to all of these scenarios. The new async and await keywords in C# 5 aim to make asynchronous programming much easier. Rather than having to break your program up into dozens of callbacks, you can continue to program in an imperative style and leave the compiler to do the hard work for you. What would once have been a major refactor can now be achieved with a few small additions and tweaks. In this example-focused talk, I'll take a bunch of synchronous code and turn it asynchronous, exploring the benefits of doing so. Kaffepaus 14:15-14:30 14:30-15:15 Putting your events on a diet - Andreas Öhlund A common problem when designing service oriented architectures is that events going across services tend to be very large in terms of properties they carry. This has the negative effect of making development tougher, testing harder and deployment a risky operation. In this talk, NServiceBus and Enterprise Software Expert Andreas Öhlund will analyse the checkout process of an online retailer to identify some of the misconceptions that lead to fat events. 15:15-16:00 The Pain of Relational Dominance- Jonathan Worthington We all know the drill. Design a database. Write code against it, maybe helped along by some ORM. As the system grows, add more tables to the database... And where does it lead us? All too often, to databases with hundreds of tables, monolithic applications, and all sorts of other pain. It's not that relational databases are bad per se; they're just somewhat overused, and widely misused. In this talk, I'll pick apart the causes of some of the pain this can lead to. I'll discuss why using events can help to free us from this situation, and lead to some powerful unifications. Along the way, I'll also show how the CQRS architectural pattern points the way to a migration strategy to something better. 16:00-16:30 Q&A Välkommen!

title: The Challenge of Connected Data - Dr Jim Webber
subTitle: Neo4j Öresund
description: In this talk, we'll cover the key ideas of NOSQL databases, including motivating similarities and more importantly their different strengths and weaknesses. In more depth, we'll focus on the characteristics of graph stores for connected data and the kinds of problems for which they are best suited. To reinforce how useful graph stores are, we provide a rapid, code-focussed example using Neo4j covering the APIs for manipulating and traversing graphs. We'll then use this knowledge to explore the Doctor Who universe, using graph databases to infer useful knowledge from connected, semi-structured data. We conclude with a discussion of when different kinds of NOSQL stores are most appropriate. Dr. Jim Webber is Chief Scientist with Neo Technology the company behind the popular open source graph database Neo4j, where he researches and develops distributed graph databases and writes open source software. Previously, Jim spent time working with big graphs like the Web for building distributed systems, which led him to being a co-author on the book REST in Practice, having previously written Developing Enterprise Web Services - An Architect's Guide. Jim is active in the development community, presenting regularly around the world. His blog is located at http://jimwebber.org and he tweets often @jimwebber. Register here

title: CQRS Workshop - Allard Buijze
subTitle: Master Class
description: This Workshop has been postponed to later date, not determine yet. Overview This introductory workshop is a good way to get a brief overview of the possibilities of CQRS and how they can be applied using the Axon Framework. The workshop divides the available time into roughly half theory, while the other half of time is available for several labs, where you learn the concepts hands-on. Attendees will gain insight into how a CQRS-based architecture can help build scalable, extensible and high-performance applications. The training contains a large number of hands-on labs allowing attendees to directly apply the theory in practice. Many of these labs will involve actual development of CQRS components using the Axon Framework. Topics The workshop aims at giving a thorough overview of the possibilities of CQRS and Axon. The following topics will be covered in this workshop: Introduction to CQRS Architecture and building blocks Event Sourcing Task based user interfaces Domain Modeling Introduction to Bounded Contexts, Entities, Aggregates and Value Objects Choosing Aggregate boundaries Basic introduction to the Axon framework Advanced transaction management Testing CQRS applications The labs contain both design and coding exercises that will be executed in small teams. The latter will be done using the Axon Framework. Prerequisites for the attendees For the developing attendees, a good understanding of the Java language is required. Enterprise application development experience is an advantage. Developers are expected to bring their own laptop with the IDE of their choice. For non-developing attendees, it is useful if they have some affinity with Java, although practical coding-experience is not required. The labs are organized in such a manner, that developers and non-developers are mixed to enable interesting discussions and learn from each other's point-of-view. Allard Buijze is software architect at Orange11 (now a part of the Trifork A/S group), and is an Amsterdam based company that delivers software development, consultancy and training services to both national and international organizations. As an architect, he is responsible for the technical choices in his projects and investigates technologies for their potential in the diversity of projects Orange11 does. For the last decade, he has been developing and designing enterprise applications for both large-scale and smaller projects. His focus has always been on clean application design, maintainability and testing. The training of co-developers is a very important part thereof. Allard has given several trainings in the areas of test driven development, application design and clean coding. He strongly believes that good craftsmanship can only be achieved through continuous and intensive exchange of experience with others. The last years, he has been investigating and applying CQRS to a number of projects. As a result, he founded the Axon Framework, an open source Java framework that helps developers create scalable and extensible applications by providing the building blocks that CQRS based infrastructures typically require. Axon has an active and growing community and has already been used to successfully realize several projects around the world. Allard has previously presented at NL-JUG, GOTO conference (f.k.a. JAOO), Jazoon and several smaller conferences. Lunch, coffee, fruits and documentation is included.

title: Lean Architecture - James Coplien
subTitle: Master Class
description: Want to learn about all the buzz around Lean Architecture and the new book? How to get architecture into your Scrum process? Get the details at this course! Agile has long shunned up-front design. When Agilists force themselves to do up-front work, it usually is limited to a symbolic use of User Stories for requirements and metaphor for architecture, with much of the rest left to refactoring. Experience and formal studies have shown that incremental approaches to architecture can possibly lead to poor structure in the long term. This course shows how to use domain analysis in a Lean way to build an architecture of form that avoids the mass of structure that usually accompanies big up-front design, using only judicious documentation. It will also show how architecture can accommodate incremental addition of features using Trygve Reenskaug’s new DCI (Data, Context and Interaction) approach, and how it maps elegantly onto C++ implementations. The course is based on the new Wiley book Lean Architecture. James ("Cope") Coplien is the father of Organizational Patterns, is one of the founders of the Software Pattern discipline, a pioneer in practical object-oriented design in the early 1990s and is a widely consulted authority, author, and trainer in the areas of software design and organizational improvements. As one of the founders and proponents of Agile software development, one of Cope's passions is to work with David Starr and the inventors of Scrum to facilitate Scrum's evolution as formalized in the Scrum Guide. He also is actively leading the work in Agile Architecture in conjunction the Scrum community. Most recently he has been working with Trygve Reenskaug to take the DCI architecture forward. He sits on the editorial board of the LNCS Pattern Journal. He is certified as a CSM, CSPO, and CST. The course includes documentation, coffee/tea and lunch

title: Förstå din IT - Det tjänar du på!
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Genom bättre förståelse för sin IT är det möjligt för IT avdelningar att spara stora pengar, och därmed öka "ROI" på sina investeringar. Hur får du koll på kostnadsdrivare i din organisation? Och hur håller du dem i schack? Första steget för kostnadseffektiv IT är såklart att ha "koll på läget". Malmöbaserade InfraSight Labs och programvaran vScope hjälper företag och organisationer få den kollen, och möjliggör därmed besparingar på många olika sätt. Genom att hantera data om ITn på ett business intelligence liknande sätt, tar de en ny approach på begrepp som licens- och resursoptimering, change management, monitorering, CMDB, IT documentation och mycket mer! Torsdagen den 20 september berättar grundarna till InfraSight Labs mer om sin vision om att enkelt kunna leverera "förståelse" om IT till alla nivåer inom företaget. Kvällen bjuder även på berättelsen om InfraSight Labs resa från ett forskningsprojekt på IBM research i Zurich till ett tech-start-up i Malmö och London, och hur man som litet start-up gör när man tar fram en avancerad enterprise-produkt. Målgrupp: CIOer, IT-chefer, driftansvariga, och andra beslutsfattare inom IT Välkommen! Registrera dig här

title: Datorn har du skaffat för att vara effektiv, men är du effektiv?
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Då film kom till var det mest teater på duken, sedan kom teven och det blev film på duken. Sedan kom datorn och den blev… en skrivmaskin. Det tog tid innan filmen och teven hittade sina speciella format och det tar tid innan datorn börjar användas som dator och inte bara som "mer-av-samma". Ett föredrag om flöde i livet. Föredraget avser att visa hur man kan arbeta på helt nya sätt med detta nya verktyg, exempelvis för samarbete på distans, för den individuella effektiviteten och mycket annat. Här avser ordet "dator" också en smart mobil, en iPad eller andra verktyg som vi kan omges om för att vara effektiva. Frågan som inställer sig då är "Varför all denna effektivitet?" Svaret kommer och kanske håller du med om det. Jorge de Sousa Pires, docent, lektor i Medieteknik, Linnéuniversitetet, Växjö Välkommen! Registrera dig här

title: Advanced TDD Subjects for .NET Developers - Roy Osherove
subTitle: Master Class
description: In this 1 day Master Class we will take a look at the following subjects: The Concept of Mocks, Stubs and Fakes, Hand Written Fakes, Isolation (Mocking) Frameworks, Pros and cons of hand written vs. isolation frameworks, proxy based vs. profiler based isolation frameworks, Refactoring Techniques on legacy untestable code, using a profiler framework with legacy code (typemock), Test Hierarchies, Review of existing open source tests with DOs and DONTs Prerequisites Experience in unit testing, no experience with mocks or stubs needed Who should attend .NET developers with experience in unit testing Tutor Roy Osherove is one of the original ALT.NET organizers. He consults and trains teams worldwide on the gentle art of unit testing, test-driven development andhow to lead software teams. He frequently speaks at international conferences on these topics and others. Roy is the author of the book The Art of Unit Testing, and writes about subjects such as unit testing, TDD Team Leadership and agile development on his blog is at osherove.com/blog Roy joins Bouvet.no in Norway this september. Lunch, coffee, fruits and documentation is included.

title: Advanced TDD Subjects for .NET Developers - Roy Osherove
subTitle: Master Class (sthlm)
description: In this 1 day Master Class we will take a look at the following subjects: The Concept of Mocks, Stubs and Fakes, Hand Written Fakes, Isolation (Mocking) Frameworks, Pros and cons of hand written vs. isolation frameworks, proxy based vs. profiler based isolation frameworks, Refactoring Techniques on legacy untestable code, using a profiler framework with legacy code (typemock), Test Hierarchies, Review of existing open source tests with DOs and DONTs Prerequisites Experience in unit testing, no experience with mocks or stubs needed Who should attend .NET developers with experience in unit testing Tutor Roy Osherove is one of the original ALT.NET organizers. He consults and trains teams worldwide on the gentle art of unit testing, test-driven development andhow to lead software teams. He frequently speaks at international conferences on these topics and others. Roy is the author of the book The Art of Unit Testing, and writes about subjects such as unit testing, TDD Team Leadership and agile development on his blog is at osherove.com/blog Roy joins Bouvet.no in Norway this september. Lunch, coffee, fruits and documentation is included.

title: Introduction to Neo4j (and Doctor Who) - Dr Jim Webber
subTitle: Master Class
description: Graph databases are an esoteric but powerful member of the NOSQL family. For highly connected data, graph databases can be thousands of times faster than relational databases, making Neo4j popular for managing complex data across many domains from finance to social, and telecoms to geospatial. This tutorial covers the core functionality from the Neo4j graph database, providing a mixture of theory and accompanying practical sessions to demonstrate the capabilities of graph data and the Neo4j database. Specifically attendees will learn about: - NoSQL and Graph Database overview - Neo4j Fundamentals and Architecture - The Neo4j Core API - Indexing - Neo4j Traverser APIs - Declarative querying with Cypher - Graph algorithms - Solutions architecture: using Neo4j in large systems Each session (apart from the fundamentals and architecture) will be a mixture of a small amount of theory combined with a set of practical exercises designed to reinforce how to achieve sophisticated goals with Neo4j. The practical parts of the tutorial consist of Koan-style lessons where a specific aspect of the Neo4j stack is presented as a set of failing unit tests which participants will work to fix, gradually becoming more challenging until the attendees are capable of implementing sophisticated graph operations against Neo4j. Attendees won't need any previous experience with Neo4j or NOSQL databases, but will require some fluency in Java, a little familiarity with a modern IDE, and a basic understanding of JUnit to help complete the lab tasks. Dr. Jim Webber is Chief Scientist with Neo Technology the company behind the popular open source graph database Neo4j, where he researches and develops distributed graph databases and writes open source software. Previously, Jim spent time working with big graphs like the Web for building distributed systems, which led him to being a co-author on the book REST in Practice, having previously written Developing Enterprise Web Services - An Architect's Guide. Jim is active in the development community, presenting regularly around the world. His blog is located at http://jimwebber.org and he tweets often @jimwebber. Lunch, coffee, fruits and documentation is included.

title: Elastic Leadership Concepts - Roy Osherove
subTitle: Master Class
description: Software Team Leader Essential Skills and Elastic Leadership Concepts In this 1 day Master Class, we will cover: The three basic stages of team abilities (chaos, learning, self organization), elastic leadership concepts, the team leader manifesto and reasonings, influence forces and understanding why people do what they do, how to grow your team to be self organizing, and why most team's are not really ready to become agile yet (and what to do about it), how to deal with difficult behavior in the team. Prerequisites No experience in management needed, but at least one year experience working/leading in a software team. Who should attend Architects, Technical and non technical team leaders, scrum masters, soon-to-be leaders, project managers, senior developers, consultants. Roy Osherove is one of the original ALT.NET organizers. He consults and trains teams worldwide on the gentle art of unit testing, test-driven development andhow to lead software teams. He frequently speaks at international conferences on these topics and others. Roy is the author of the book The Art of Unit Testing, and writes about subjects such as unit testing, TDD Team Leadership and agile development on his blog is at osherove.com/blog Roy joins Bouvet.no in Norway this september. Lunch, coffee, fruits and documentation is included.

title: Elastic Leadership Concepts - Roy Osherove
subTitle: Master Class (sthlm)
description: Software Team Leader Essential Skills and Elastic Leadership Concepts In this 1 day Master Class, we will cover: The three basic stages of team abilities (chaos, learning, self organization), elastic leadership concepts, the team leader manifesto and reasonings, influence forces and understanding why people do what they do, how to grow your team to be self organizing, and why most team's are not really ready to become agile yet (and what to do about it), how to deal with difficult behavior in the team. title: Kom och lär dig koda
subTitle: CoderDojo Malmö
description: OBS! CoderDojo är fullbokat men du kan anmäla dig till en köplats (nedan) CoderDojo är en rörelse för att lära barn och ungdomar programmera. I Malmö började vi våren 2012. Det är gratis att komma till CoderDojo Malmö och är öppet för alla mellan 7 och 17 år. Du kan få lära dig att programmera, göra appar, spel och hemsidor. Du behöver inte kunna programmera innan du kommer. Mentorerna är programmerare som gör CoderDojo på sin fritid, utan att få betalt. De flesta jobbar som programmerare. Det betyder också att vi inte är utbildade lärare, men vi gör vårt bästa :-) Det är inte ett företag eller organisation som ligger bakom CoderDojo Malmö, utan vi kommer från många olika ställen. Notera att om du är under 12 år så måste du ha en förälder med dig på våra träffar. Ta med egen bärbar dator - om du inte har en bärbar dator - mejla carina@foocafe.org så ska vi försöka ordna en lånedator. Läs mer på CoderDojo Malmö's hemsida Hösten 2015 fokuserar vi på följande: - Programmera spel med Scratch - Bygga webbsidor med HTML, JavaScript och CSS - Styra och bygga robotar med Arduino Vi genomför CoderDojo varje Måndag och Onsdag fram till Sommaren. Sponsor: Just nu är det fullbokat. Ni kan sätta upp er på reservlistan, så kan vi meddela er så snart vi får fler platser (helt beroende på om vi får fler mentorer). Om Ni redan har anmält er till CoderDojo så behöver Ni inte göra det igen. Anmälan till CoderDojo avser deltagande i allmänhet och inte till ett specifikt datum.

title: Visual Studio 2012 Lansering
subTitle: SweNUG
description: Visual Studio 2012 släpps och vi ska uppmärksamma detta här på Foo Café. Live-stream direkt från eventet i Seattle. Vi bjuder givetvis på mat och dryck i vanlig ordning ;-) Registrera dig här. Meet up sponsor

title: PodioKit presentation and more...
subTitle: CocoaHeads
description: Hot on the heals of the new iOS device announcements, Cocoa hackers of the Øresund region will meet again to share knowledge, socialize and listen to presentations on cutting-edge Cocoa technologies. The main speaker this time is Sebastian Rehnby who works at Podio. He will tell us about how he created a framework for interfacing with the Podio server API from iOS, and solutions he created for networking, data mapping and more. For you who saw the presentation on RestKit at our last meetup, this will be an interesting follow-up, since PodioKit is inspired by RestKit. Also, new for this time is the nice price we will award the person who makes the best 2 minute presentation during the Open Floor time slot. So think of something cool you want to show off: a UI component you created, an open source tool you've found, an awesome button design, a mind-blowing libobjc hack. Anything. We're here to share and learn, so get creative! Finally, we're very happy to announce that CocoaHeads Malmö will henceforth take place at Foo Café, a venue for hackers that just made it out of beta! See you soon! Program 18:30 Opening. 19:00 Welcome and introduction. 19:10 Parse - The mobile app platform for developers. Parse offers a great way to quickly build a server backend for your app, with geopositioning, push notifications and more, without having to host or manage your own server. Presenter: Patrik Svensson 19:40 Break 20:00 PodioKit - A request management and data mapping library for the Podio API. Presenter: Sebastian Rehnby 21:00 Open Floor. Anyone who wants to show a new app, library or cool trick is welcome to make a presentation. 2-5 minutes each. 21:30 Time to go home. Register here

title: HTML5 & Affärsnytta i mobilen!
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Frukostseminarium om HTML5 och mobilens möjligheter. Seminariet är kostnadsfritt. 2011 var året då Sveriges företag kom på att de "måste ha en app". 2012 kan bli året då man faktiskt börjar fundera på hur mobilen kan bidra till ökad affärsnytta. Det hoppas i alla fall Claes Persson, MoMA. Välkommen till ett seminarium om HTML5 och mobilens möjligheter. Claes kommer bl.a. att prata om HTML5, mobilsurfandets utveckling, den mobila kanalens möjligheter och skillnaden mellan e-handel och m-handel. Dessutom visas exempel på hur mobilen kan skapa konkret affärsnytta. Claes Persson är grundare av MoMA – Masters of Mobile Arts och en av veteranerna inom mobil marknadsföring och kommunikation. Med erfarenheter från 20 år i IT-branschen nationellt och internationellt hjälper han Sveriges största företag med strategier och implementation kring den mobila närvaron.

title: Cypher vs SQL: a declarative graph query language
subTitle: Neo4j Öresund
description: Cypher is a graph query language used in Neo4j. Much like SQL, it's a declarative language used for querying databases. In this talk, Andrés Taylor, a former SQL DBA, will compare and contrast the two. What does an join look like in Cypher? What about an left outer join? There are a lot of similarities between the two - Cypher is heavily influenced by SQL. We'll talk about what these common concepts are, and of course, we'll talk about the differences, what Cypher gives you that SQL leaves you wanting. Speaker Hi, I'm Andrés Taylor, lead Cypheriologist at Neo Technology, the company behind Neo4j. Making Cypher is my therapy after years and years of relational thinking and coding. I'm keen to show you how graph databases and Cypher can make your daily grunt a little bit easier. Register here

title: by entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs with a special guest speaker
subTitle: Startup Dojo
description: There’s never been a better time to get started Do you have a great business idea but don’t know how to take it to the next level? Come and talk with experienced entrepreneurs at Startup Dojo! Test your ideas, get advice, enhance your pitch, find co-founders and investors, or just be inspired by your fellow-entrepreneurs. Objective To help more people become [successful] startup entrepreneurs. Principles By entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs A Startup Dojo is where entrepreneurs meet to help each other become more successful in their startup ventures. If you are not an entrepreneur, nor wanting to become one, you have no business in the dojo. Iteration through Build-Measure-Learn “Step one is to have a strong vision. You must then test that vision against reality, and then decide whether to pivot or persevere.” - Eric Ries, author of The Lean Startup Start with a Minimum Viable Product A Minimum Viable Product has just those features that allow the product to be deployed, and no more. Ideas are nothing without execution And the only way to achieve great execution is to talk about your ideas and get feedback along the way. Just do it! There is always a way. The only thing stopping you is your own mind. Guest speaker Robert Schäfer Don’t Fake it. Make it. Robert’s inspiring seminar will take you through the essential process of rediscovering your values and aspirations to define your vision. You will get key advice to create a clear picture of your ideal lifestyle, and to find ways to make it a reality. Robert will notably give an introduction to the “Rainbow Map”, a tool to put your personal and professional priorities at the centre of your action plan for positive change. He will then discuss the importance of self branding. To effectively promote yourself and your activity, your brand should accurately communicate who you are, what you do, and how you do it. Be true to yourself and your clients will trust you. Standing for what you believe in will be your best competitive advantage over those who think they have to pretend. So… Don’t fake it. Make it. more about Robert Schäfer International and successful are the first words that come to mind when considering Robert’s career. Born in Sydney, raised in Vienna, he took up managerial and leadership roles within multinationals, from Europe to Australia, creating several companies along the way. A qualified technical analyst, he was all set up for early retirement, but keener to mentor a new generation of enthusiast lifestyle entrepreneurs. He founded mnm institute, his own registered training organisation. 300 international students, mainly from Europe and South America, are currently involved in his development programs, building their dream. 60% of these participants are degree qualified, all here to take things off the whiteboard and into reality. Startup Dojo is sponsored by: Together with Start Up Dojo we also arrange a Watify doubt session, where experienced entrepreneurs such as Johan Skärskog (Netcompetence) and Petronella Gustafsson (ProgressMe) tell about their doubts before starting, failures, experiences but also gives advice on what to think about when starting your digital business. Mentors: Martin Walfisz Erik Starck Tom Kealey We will meet once per month. Welcome!

title: Best After Work Ever w special guest; Erik Meijer
subTitle: This is Geek Night
description: The Best Geek Night Ever! We will have the best Geek Night ever, in a truly Foo Café spirit. There will be three activities- we will start our evening at 16.00 with a presentation by Erik Meijer, Microsoft Research (Erik on Wikipedia). Following that will there be an After Work with free beer/wine (until we are out of stock!) and food from 17.00-21.00. Then! will Code Clubbing start. You can choose to register for one, two or all three activities - it’s up to you. Erik Meijer’s talk will be on “The Story of the Teapot in HTML” Would you believe that the image below of the famous Utah Teapot is rendered using just div elements and CSS without any OpenGL, WebGL, Canvas, or other "real" graphics capabilities? In this fun talk, we will explain this glorious hack we first learned from a blogpost by Jeff Lau aka Useless Pickles, and that we subsequently used as a demo for our IL to JavaScript compiler project. While the original Live Labs project has long gone to the happy hunting grounds of technology, we salvaged this little pearl as a timeless demonstration of doing a lot with very little. Erik's talk is sponsored by; Afterwork - Need we say more? Yes, the sing and song writer Tim Schmidt will be playing live! Code Clubbing #000004 takes place directly after the After Work at 21.00 and we will go on thru the night. Take your headphones off, and get out of your cave. Club like you've never clubbed before. You, the creators, the wicked ones, you bring the computers, and we bring to you the DJs and sweet music all night long! You code, design, hack, wreck a sac, to the beats of house and funky dub. Awesome people, awesome music, awesome place. Simple as that. No strings attached. That's all it's about. And what it's all about. Come on, join in. Go crazy, you've got it all within. Now's the night to release it. Welcome and Enjoy our Geek Night. Register here

title: Kravhantering: det vi ser är bara toppen av isberget
subTitle: SARE - Frukost
description: Vi börjar morgonen med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00 - Därefter kommer Dr. Tony Gorschek att hålla en timmes presentation. Kravhantering har traditionellt förknippats med projektbaserade textspecifikationer som överlämnas till projekt för realisering. Verkligheten är dock att kravhantering är en kontinuerlig aktivitet som till stor del är helt projektoberoende - en del av strategiska beslut och produktledning. Seminariet går igenom en rik vy av kravhantering, med dess potential, samt de centrala utmaningar som kan förknippas med att välja vilka produkter som ska utvecklas, och VAD som ska inkluderas i dessa produkter. Dr. Tony Gorschek is a Professor of Software Engineering at Blekinge Institute of Technology (BTH). He has over ten years industrial experience as a senior executive consultant and engineer, but also as chief architect and product manager. In addition he has built up five startups in fields ranging from logistics to internet based services. Currently he manages his own consultancy company, works as a CTO, and serves on several boards in companies developing cutting edge technology and products. His research interests include requirements engineering, technology and product management, process assessment and improvement, quality assurance, and practical innovation. He is a member of IEEE and ACM. For more information/publications/contact: www.gorschek.com Frukostseminariesponsor; Detta eventet är FULL BOKAT!

title: Fokus på JavaScript
subTitle: Lat55 meetup
description: Lat55 är en user group i Skåne som organiserar meetups som handlar om kreativa och nybanande teknologier. Vi träffas på regelbunden basis, normalt var sjätte vecka, då vi diskuterar aktuella ämnen i vårt intressefält. Tidigare träffar har tagit upp exempelvis: UX, WebGL, CoffeeScript, JavaScript, 3D i Flash, HTML5 Canvas, Mobilutveckling för mobila enheter, CSS gradienter, m.m. Denna gången hamnar fokus på JavaScript. Backbone.js – Power to the frontend En grundläggande introduktion till Backbone.js, dess styrkor och hur det hjälper att bygga en flexibel och välstrukturerad frontend. Talare: Johannes Hansen Om intresset finns kommer vi att göra en uppföljning på denna föreläsningen redan innan jul, där Johannes går mer in på djupet i Backbone.js. Firebase – En skalbar backend för webbapplikationer Nu kan du på ett enkelt sätt bygga skalbara realtidsapplikationer i Javascript utan att behöva bry dig om att bygga ett tjänstelager. Firebase fungerar som en REST endpoint och du hämtar och skriver data med Javascript. Denna föreläsningen tar dig genom de vanligaste funktionerna i Firebase. Talare: Patric Lanhed Vi tänkte också göra en variant på open mic, där vem som helst får max 5 minuter att berätta om ett valfritt ämne. Böcker från O’Reilly Alla som kommer till vår meetup hos Foo Café får ett värdebevis för att ladda ner valfri eBook från O’Reilly gratis. Vi kommer också antagligen ha möjligheten att dela ut gamla hederliga pappersböcker från O’Reilly – med motprestationen att skriva en recension som publiceras på vår sajt och/eller andra sajter. Att komma på våra meetups är gratis och vem som helst som vill får komma, men vi tycker det är trevligt att veta vilka som kommer, så vänligen boka din plats nedan. Meetup sponsor Välkomna! Lat55 meet-up är FULL BOKAD!

title: Global day of Coderetreat
subTitle: Coderetreat
description: Malmö is participating in the Global Day of Coderetreat 2012! Coderetreat (http://coderetreat.org/about) is a day-long, intensive practice event focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a fun and highly effective means of skill improvement. For 32 hours on December 8th, Coderetreats will be held all over the world as part of the Global Day of Coderetreat. The Global Day of Coderetreat helps to raise awareness of Coderetreats and brings people together from all over the world. Most importantly, The Global Day of Coderetreat helps to support global efforts to find, encourage, and educate the next generation of software developers (through the Coderetreat Community Contribution Fund). Last year, 94 cities participated. This year, we anticipate approximately 200 cities will participate with an average of 15-20 participants per city. To celebrate this significant event, we'll be participating in some global activities in addition to our normal Coderetreat activities. Afterwards, stick around and we'll all go out to dinner or for a few drinks. It's going to be a lot of fun! You only need to bring a laptop with the development tools you require to write code using your chosen programming languages. A continental breakfast and lunch will be provided. CodeRetreat Facilitators; - Martin Mazur - tretton37 - Balázs Suhajda - onereason - Joakim Karlsson - Softhouse Global Day of Coderetreat is brought to you by;

title: Raka spåret för produktutveckling
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar morgonen med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00 - Därefter kommer Arne Åhlander och Micael Åkesson hålla ett seminarie i 1,5 timme. Går det att erbjuda en produkt med marknadsmässig funktionalitet och samtidigt leverera i tid till en global marknad som konstant ropar efter produktreleaser? Seminariet ”Raka spåret för produktutveckling” ger tips på hur du skapar struktur i utvecklingsarbetet. Vi belyser de centrala frågorna som löpande bör ställas under arbetet. Utifrån ett konkret scenario visar vi hur Agile utvecklingsmetodik kan kompletteras med strukturerad kravhantering med hjälp av Reguirement Abstraction Model (RAM) Kombinationen av Agile produktledning och RAM-modellen ger er möjlighet till effektiviseringsvinster i utvecklingsorganisationen. Nyckeln är att dagligen arbeta med olika aktiviteter, den s.k. planeringslöken. Knyt till den en ram och se till att det finns sammanhang i kraven. Så korsbefruktas offensiv produktledning och utvecklingsmetodik. ”ta tjuren vid hornen och kombinera Agile utvecklingsmetodik med strukturerad kravhantering enligt RAM-modellen” Många byter ut traditionell projekt-ledningsmetodik mot ett agilt förhållningssätt i hopp om att leverera i tid. Ändå lyckas inte projekten. Vad är det som fallerar? Många gånger saknas tillräckligt stöd i kravhanteringen för att genomföra Agile utveckling. Tydligast är detta i stora företag men även mindre företag vinner på ett strukturerat angreppssätt. Välkommen till en frukost-workshop som visar hur det är möjligt att ta tjuren vid hornen och kombinera Agile utvecklings-metodik med strukturerad kravhantering enligt RAM-modellen. De utgör framgångsfaktorer inte bara för utvecklingsarbetet i sig utan i lika hög utsträckning för team som finns i projekten. ”en hävstång för att hämta hem flera effektivitetsvinster i organisationen” Seminariet leds av Arne Åhlander, produktledningsexpert och grundare av konsultföretaget Aqqurite AB, www.aqqurite.se, och Micael Åkesson, med lång erfarenhet av produktutveckling och kravhantering från ett globalt verksamhetsfält. Micael driver konsultföretaget Lund Requirements and Solutions, www.requirementsandsolutions.se Frukostseminariet är ett samarbete med: Frukostseminariet är FULL BOKAT!

title: The "Being" and "Doing" Work of an Agile Coach - Lyssa Adkins & Michael Spayd
subTitle: Coach Agile Teams
description: We will start with mingle at 17.30 and the session begins at 18.00. Would you like to help your team transition into the "joyful pursuit of acting as a high performance team?" Do you want to understand what you should be "doing" as an Agile coach, but also how to "be" a coach? More and more frequently, ScrumMasters and project managers are being asked to coach agile teams. This challenging role requires new skills - as well as a subtle understanding of when to step in and when to step back. Migrating from "command and control" to agile coaching requires a whole new mind-set. This leaves many wondering, "What is my role in a self-organized team? How do I help the team yet stay hands-off?" "Is this a leadership role, or not?" It is easy to go too far to either extreme - some take too much control, while others leave the team too much alone to "self-organize". In this session, Lyssa Adkins and Michael K. Spayd explore the world of Agile Coaching and the related discipline of professional coaching, providing a framework for thinking about our new disciipline, the new competencies it requires, and the new way of being that makes it all work. Lyssa Adkins Since 2004, I have taught Scrum to hundreds of students, coached many agile teams, and served as master coach to many apprentice coaches. In both one-on-one settings and small groups, I enjoy a front-row seat as remarkable agile coaches emerge and go on to entice the very best from the teams they coach. Prior to agile, I had more than fifteen years of expertise leading project teams and groups of project managers (I was even a PMO Director — twice!), yet nothing prepared me for the power of agile done simply and well. Michael Spayd In a word, my professional work is about transformation. I seem to be wired to help people–and systems–change. I am drawn to cutting edge ‘technologies’ for coaching and developing organizations, leaders and teams. I have worked as an organizational change coach and consultant for more than 20 years, working with Fortune 500, small businesses and non-profits. For 11 years I have specialized in large-scale Agile transformation efforts, working with numerous organizations, leaders, and over 75 teams in that time.

title: Sociala medier - för alla - alltid
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Vad händer just nu inom sociala medier? Hur kan vi lära oss att använda det på rätt sätt? Måste man? Är det farligt? Frågorna är många om sociala medier och svaren är ibland lika många som användarna. Men det finns hopp! Vi presenterar en nätverksgrupp som samlas en gång i månaden för att diskutera sociala medier, förutsättningslöst och på deltagarnas villkor. Med Social Media Club Skåne kan alla vara med och diskutera, och inga frågor är fel. Vi berättar om Social Media Club Skåne, men även om vad sociala medier egentligen är och hur det kan komma att se ut i morgon? Vi kommer även att berätta om hur man kan använda Facebook i sin marknadsföring. Vad får man lov att göra och får man inte lov göra? Och om varför det är en dålig idé att köpa gillare. Föreläsare: Leif Kajrup (Kajrup communication), föreläsare, internetstrateg och projektledare samt initiativtagare och arrangör till Social Media Club Skåne. Vi har ännu inte ett DF nätverk i södra kretsen inom Sociala Medier, kanske kan denna aktivitet inspirera?! Välkommen! Registrera dig här Om du önskar beställa en macka till självkostnadspris (pris 50.-) gör du det under kommentar och betalar kontant vid mötets början

title: MongoDB - Ensuring High Availability for Real-time Analytics
subTitle: CopenhagenJS
description: Real time analytics is a compelling use case for MongoDB, but only if everything is up and running smoothly. We'll talk about how to set up and configure MongoDB to maintain high performance and redundancy. This will cover what to consider for high write throughput performance from hardware configuration through to the use of replica sets, multi-data centre deployments, monitoring and sharding to ensure your database is fast and stays online. David Mytton is the founder of Server Density. He has been programming in PHP and Python for over 10 years, regularly speaks about MongoDB (including running the London MongoDB User Group), co-founded the Open Rights Group and can often be found cycling in London or drinking tea in Japan. Organized in co-operation with Meet-up sponsor is;

title: Live-streaming av Build Keynote
subTitle: SweNUG
description: För ett år sedan körde vi live-streaming av keynoten för Build-konferensen där Windows 8 visades upp. Nu kör vi live-stream på keynoten för årets Build-konferens som sker i samband med att Windows 8 lanseras mer officiellt. Vi bjuder på mat och dryck i vanlig ordning. Meet up sponsor

title: Visual Studio 2012 tjuvstart
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00. Föreläsningen startar 08.00 och pågår till 09.00. Nu är den här! Som vanligt brukar det dröja minst ett halvår innan folk kommer igång med att uppgradera men efter denna sessionen kan du köra igång direkt! Vad sägs om smidigare snabbare IDE, .net 4.5 där asynkrod kod blir begriplig för alla, Lightswitch, Metro apps, model binders i asp.net web forms, html5 stöd, Team Foundation Server med planering på fler plan... Markus Rytterkull är en erfaren konsult och lärare som tror starkt på allas möjligheter att växa som människor, och leva ett fritt och ansvarsfullt liv. Så länge som man skriver lättläst och effektiv kod, dvs ;-) Förutom att arbeta med kurser och mentorskap inom .net, webbutveckling, SQL server och utvecklingsprocesser, så blir det mycket arbete med högpresterande och coola webbsajter i roliga projekt. Frukostseminariet är ett samarnbete med;

title: Visualising your thoughts and assumptions to create a dynamic organisation
subTitle: Breakfast seminar
description: We start with breakfast between 07.30-08.00. Presentation starts at 08.00 and continues until 09.00. Do successful organisations achieve their full potential or could they do better? How do you ensure that your organisation grows during an economic recession? How do you improve collaboration in your organisation or team? How do you improve collaboration in your organisation or team? We will introduce you to 5 simple tools (Post-IT level technology) that visualise thinking processes, which will help you to achieve personal and the organisations full potential. By building on this knowledge your organisation will be better prepared to get a comparative advantage over the competition and survive economic downturns. Don has more than 25 years of experience delivering projects in Europe, Africa and Asia, ranging from business restructuring and turnaround to delivery of e-commerce solutions. This Breakfast seminar is in co-operation with;

title: Windows Azure aktuellt för Utvecklare
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00. Föreläsningen startar 08.00 och pågår till 09.00. Ganska länge kändes Molnet lite fluffigt avlägset för många utvecklare. Nu blir det allt mer uppenbart att det är en tjock molnbank som drar in som kommer att överskugga all utveckling vi gör nu och i framtiden. Vad är det till exempel som gör så att dina Appar kan skicka meddelanden och få notifikationer? Molnet är ryggraden för Media Services, Roaming Profiles och Windows Push Notifications. Hur ska man spara kostnader på utvecklings- och testavdelningen? Molnet har förutsättningar för rationaliseringar på området Continuous Delivery. På vilket sätt kan ni mest effektivt leverera de tjänster och applikationer ni bygger? Med hjälp utav Molnet och tankar kring multitennancy har vi en helt ny värld av möjligheter framför oss! Kom på ett seminarie där vi pratar om världen för utvecklare i och med Molnets intåg i vår verklighet. Magnus Mårtensson är Norra Europas enda Microsoft Most Valuable Professional på Windows Azure Platformen. Han arbetar som konsult hos Active Solution med att hjälpa ISVer och andra kunder migrera till eller bygga nytt för Molnet. Magnus har mångårig erfarenhet som Arkitekt och Tech Lead på stora kundprojekt och skriver kod varje dag. Han dyker ofta upp på konferenser, både nationellt men även internationellt, eller i utveckalrcommunities som talare och engagerad eldsjäl för .NET Teknologi i allmänhet och Windows Azure i synnerhet! Full fart och energi och en brinnande glädje för teknologi är Magnus ledstjärnor i arbetslivet. Frukostseminariet är ett samarnbete med;

subTitle: Conference

title: 2012: Virtuella valutor eller byteshandel?
subTitle: Konferens - IT South
description: Konferensen är flyttad till våren - nytt datum kommer att publiceras inom kort. Vi står inför ett paradigmskifte i våra betalningssätt! Ämnen för Dataföreningens årliga konferens: Virtuella Plånböcker, BitCoin, Lojalitetspoäng, NFC, Google Wallet, Mobila betalningar, Freemium/Premium, Säkerhet, Pengatvätt. Vi står inför ett paradigmskifte i våra betalningssätt med mobila plånböcker. Nya virtuella valutor som BitCoins & MintChip förändrar förhållningssättet till fysiska pengar. För att attrahera nya kunder krävs även förståelse för hur man i framtiden kan ta betalt för varor och tjänster, där allt mer förväntas vara gratis. Utvecklingen av lojalitetsprogram behöver också ta hänsyn till hur vi som företag kan behålla och utveckla kunderna, där de mobila lösningarna spelar en väsentlig roll. Vad är det för skillnad mellan insamlade lojalitetspoäng och en virtuell valuta? Nya tekniker som NFC (Near Field Communication) börjar tillämpas, men hur säkert är det, och vilka problem har myndigheterna kring hanteringen av mobila betalningar? Denna konferens syftar till att ge en bredare inblick i hur nya betalningssätt påverkar oss som företag och individer! Läs mer om programmet och registrera dig på http://it-south.se/wp/

title: Varumärket och jag
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00. Föreläsningen startar 08.00 och pågår till 09.00. "Personalen är vår viktigaste resurs" är en känd gammal uttjatad slogan som gäller. För konsultbolag är det mycket tydligt och för mindre och enmansföretag är varumärket ofta personer. Hur vi agerar under våra uppdrag är viktigt för vår försäljning. Sedan ska vi även hålla kundkontakterna vid liv när vi är belagda. Johan Sporre delar med sig erfarenheter kring: - situationer som uppkommit i olika verksamheter och som har påverkat kundernas upplevelse - att tänka på för att få nöjdare kunder - hur jag påverkar mitt företags varumärke - hur jag håller igång kundkontakterna när jag är ute i uppdrag. Man får med sig: - Problem och symptom som hindrar varumärkesbyggandet - Konkreta tips i att hantera relationer till kunder och kollegor Talare: Johan Sporre, PMP, har samlat på sig erfarenheter som chef och konsult från E.ON, DFDS,CapGemini, Sony Mobile Communications, Volvo IT. Han är mentor i Connect Skåne där han stödjer utveckling av nya och etablerade verksamheter. Frukostseminariet är ett samarbete med Välkommen!

title: Inbyggt möter molnet
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar med frukost mellan 07.30-08.00. Föreläsningen startar 08.00 och pågår till 09.00. År 2020 så spås vi har 20 miljarder uppkopplade prylar. En del av dessa kommer att vara uppkopplade mot olika molntjänster, men inbyggda system och molntjänster är ofta varandras motsatser: de förstnämnda är lokala system med små resurser medan de sistnämnda är globala med resurser som kan utökas med en knapptryckning. Kom och lyssna på hur vi har gjort för att kombinera båda typerna av system för att dra nytta av respektive systems styrkor. Mårten Berggren som kommer att hålla i seminariet. Mårten har lång erfarenhet inom webbaserade informationssystem, säkerhet och kryptering samt Embedded Systems. Frukostseminariet är ett samarnbete med Välkommen!

title: Lär dig mer om världens största företagsnätverk, LinkedIn!
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Vad kan du och ditt företag få ut av LinkedIn? Hur kan du effektivt använda LinkedIn? Kan LinkedIn stärka företagets varumärke? Resultify arbetar med digital marknadsföring och vill lära dig ett av sätten att öka ditt resultat på webben: - Hur att effektivt använda LinkedIn! De kommer gå igenom hur man får ut det mesta av företagssidor på LinkedIn, samt ge tips och tricks för effektiv digital marknadsföring! Med andra ord, ett PVH som du inte har råd att missa! Föreläsare: Kristina Berg, projektledare på Resultify, egenföretagare samt utbildad produktionsledare inom Media Registrera dig här Välkommen,

title: Vill du veta hur du ska göra för att ha framgång på Linkedin?
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Varför är det bra att finnas på Linkedin? Hur kan du använda Linkedin på bästa sätt? Måste man vara med? Många finns på Linkedin men gör inte mycket mer än tackar ja till kontaktförfrågningar. Det är synd att inte fler utnyttjar det jobbstrategiska hjälpmedel som Linkedin är. Skulle du vilja veta hur du bäst gör för att förvandla din Linkedin-profil från att vara en grå mus till en proffsig profil? En profil som människor lägger märke till (och som kan leda till konkreta jobberbjudanden)? Vill du lära dig hur man hittar nya affärskontakter och bäst tar kontakt med dem? Detta seminarie bjuder på konkreta Linkedin-tips. Föreläsare: Birgitta Möller (cvhjälpen.nu) CV-skribent, språkgranskare och utbildare i hur man som privatperson/egenföretagare bäst använder sig av Linkedin. subTitle: CocoaHeads

(www.jetbrains.com/objc/) 18.30 Mingling, coffee/beer 18.50 Second presentation, Touchless on cool new hands-off gesture recognizer for mobile devices. (crunchfish.com) 19.30 Two-minute presentations, then more mingling 21.00 Thanks, see you! more info will be released soon Register to this free event here

title: Specification by Example
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: User stories are widely used for defining requirements in agile projects. They are simple to understand and based on the agile principle of dialogue and cooperation. In practice, however, many find that they are difficult to work with. This was also the case for a team working on a large and strategically important software project in DSB. The solution for this team was to add Specification by Example to the mix, an emerging practice for defining requirements and business-oriented functional tests. The result was requirements that were clear to the implementation team and a fully automated acceptance test suite. The project avoided the long debugging phase projects often end with and since the initial release the team has been able to make releases to production every week. This lecture will explain the lessons learned during the two-year DSB project and along the way introduce Specification by example to the audience. About the speaker The speaker will be Martin Gildenpfennig. Martins mission is building better software faster. He is a partner in Ative, and helps development teams implement agile software development and improve their craftsmanship by teaching hands-on development practices such as iterative design and test-first This event is fully booked Welcome!

title: Datorn har du skaffat för att vara effektiv, men är du effektiv? NR 2 Fortsättningen
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Då film kom till var det mest teater på duken, sedan kom teven och det blev film på duken. Sedan kom datorn och den blev… en skrivmaskin. Det tog tid innan filmen och teven hittade sina speciella format och det tar tid innan datorn börjar användas som en @llputer och inte bara som "mer-av-samma". Ett föredrag om flöde i livet, med eller utan dator. Föredraget avser att visa hur man kan arbeta på helt nya sätt med de nya verktygen, exempelvis för samarbete på distans, för den individuella effektiviteten och mycket annat. Här avser ordet "dator" också en smart mobil, en tablet eller andra verktyg som vi kan omges om för att vara effektiva. Jag kommer även att visa iPad och iPhone i samband med effektivitet, annorlunda GUI, tal m m. Föredraget återspeglar mina val, det är ingen reklam för Apple men detta ekosystemet bidrar till helt nya möjligheter. Grundfilosofin gäller allmänt, har inget att göra med maskiner överhuvudtaget. OBS! De som varit med tidigare kommer att se nya saker. Frågan som inställer sig då är "Varför all denna effektivitet?" Svaret kommer och kanske håller du med om det. Föreläsare: Jorge de Sousa Pires, docent, lektor i Medieteknik, Linnéuniversitetet, Växjö Registrera dig här Välkommen!

title: Varumärket och Jag
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: "Personalen är vår viktigaste resurs" är en känd gammal uttjatad slogan som gäller. För konsultbolag är det mycket tydligt och för mindre och enmansföretag är varumärket ofta personer. Hur vi agerar under våra uppdrag är viktigt för vår försäljning. Sedan ska vi även hålla kundkontakterna vid liv när vi är belagda. Man får med sig: - Problem och symptom som hindrar varumärkesbyggandet - Konkreta tips i att hantera relationer till kunder och kollegor.
