VisioSign visar konkreta exempel på hur till exempel Lunds Universitet använder sig av InfoBoard för att visa lokalbokningar, inbjudningar till seminarier och rutiner i receptionen eller hur Hallandstrafiken använder digitala skyltar för att underlätta för sina resenärer när det gäller val av buss och tåg. Fischer & Kerrn visar hur man enkelt kan boka rum och resurser via deras mjukvara Concierge Services, hantera besöksbokning och utskrift av besöksbrickor samt visa denna information i digital signage-lösningar. Under dagen kommer vi att erbjuda olika typer av skräddarsydda paket tillsammans med dagsexklusiva erbjudanden. Vi bjuder även på tilltugg, kom förbi, nätverka och säg hej! För mer information om Fischer & Kerrn: http://www.fischerkerrn.com För mer info om VisioSign: http://www.visiosign.se

title: Let’s pair UX & Testing
subTitle: ConTest Special
description: This special ConTest event has a longer presentation (roughly 40 minutes) by Karen N. Johnson from Chicago, USA. We follow-up the presentation with discussions as we use to do at all ConTest events. We will begin with meet, greet and something lighter to eat at 17.30 - Karen's talk begins at 18.00. Presentation Do you find yourself needing to “check” something in production immediately after go live? Do you work as a designer immersed in UI and/or UX? Or perhaps you work as a software developer or product owner? Without realizing it, you may be performing the role of a software tester in addition to your primary role. Perhaps you want to learn a bit about software testing without entirely becoming a professional software tester. Karen outlines specific areas where UX and testing collaborate well together. She explores how the UX tools of storyboarding and personas can pair with Exploratory Testing and “tour” testing. If testing is part of what you or your team need to juggle to “make it happen” come attend this session.  About Karen N. Johnson Karen is an independent software test consultant based in Chicago. Her client work is often centered on helping organizations at an enterprise level. While focused on software testing and predominantly working with the testers throughout an organization, Karen helps teams and organizations improve quality overall. Her professional activities include speaking at conferences both in the US and internationally. Karen is a contributing author to the book, Beautiful Testing by O’Reilly publishers. She is the co-founder of the WREST workshop, the Workshop for Regulated Software Testing. She has published numerous articles; she blogs and tweets about her experiences. Find her on Twitter as @karennjohnson (note the two n’s) and her website: http://www.karennicolejohnson.com. Event sponsor

title: Den T-formade testaren – den agila superhjälten
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: Vi börjar med mingel och något enkelt att äta vid 18.00 Presentationen börjar 18.20 Presentation När systemutveckling allt mer handlar om samarbete mellan olika discipliner och kompetenser räcker det inte att testare bara är extremt duktiga inom ett specifikt område. Vi måste också ha kunskap inom andra närliggande områden för att tillsammans som ett lag kunna lösa uppgifter som blir kastade till oss. Det talas allt mer om att ha en T-formad kompetens. Medarbetare ska ha både bredd och djup. Men vad innebär det? Måste testare även kunna koda och hur djup kunskap ska vi ha på bredden? Är det rimligt att alla kan allt i ett självorganiserande team? Vi diskuterar varför den T-formade kompetensen blivit så viktig och formar tillsammans vår agila superhjälte: den T-formade testaren. Se fram emot en interaktiv kväll med intressanta diskussioner! Talare Markus Niklasson har arbetat med testning i olika former i olika projekt under åtta år. Det agila sättet att tänka har varit en inspirationskälla ända sedan han blev introducerad till Scrum och ett agilt arbetssätt 2007. Han har därefter försökt att ha med sig det agila tankesättet i bakhuvudet i allt som han gör. Markus har erfarenhet från branscher som fordon, medicin, telekom, försvar och spel. Han har även erfarenhet i form av personalansvar, sälj och rekrytering. Markus är lärare på System Verifications utbildning i ISTQB Agile Tester samt på Plushögskolan i Göteborg.

title: Har ni satt upp era företagskonton rätt?
subTitle: Social Media Club
description: Kan dina kunder verkligen hitta dig online? Om ditt företag inte registrerat sin företags- och platsinformation på ett korrekt sätt hos Facebook, Google, Instagram, Apple m.fl. så riskerar det att skada företagets marknadsföringsmöjligheter. Daniel Melkersson från PinMeTo kommer att inleda vår diskussion hur du får ett ökat inflöde av kunder utan att betala en krona med korrekt inlagda företagsuppgifter i sök och sociala medier. Du är välkommen att lyssna och diskutera hur man gör för sätta upp sina företagsuppgifter korrekt. Agenda 11.30 - 11.50 Introduktion av ämnet 11.50 - 12.30 Fortsatt gemensam diskussion och frågor Social Media Club Skåne är en ideell nätverksgrupp som träffas en gång i månaden för att diskutera sociala medier. Inga krav, inga förpliktelser. Det viktiga är att vi vill träffas och diskutera sociala medier med likasinnade. Social Media Club är en internationell non-profit organisation grundad i USA av Chris Heuer och Kristie Wells i mars 2006. Mottot är ”if you get, share it” och det är just vad det handlar om, att dela med sig av kunskap, tankar och idéer om sociala medier. Vill du veta mer om den internationella organisationen kan du läsa mer på deras hemsida socialmediaclub.org.

title: Success without Requirements Engineering
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: Requirements engineering is one of the most important phases of any software project life-cycle. The success of any software project depends heavily on high quality requirements and on a solid requirements engineering process. Is the above sentence really true? An empirical study of the requirements engineering process at Axis Communications showed that a lightweight approach can be a good alternative to a strict "best practices" approach. This talk will show how development teams at Axis work with requirements. - How much time is spent on requirements? - How many requirements are there? - How is requirements knowledge managed and shared? - How does testing work in a lightweight requirement environment? The speakers: Showayb Zahda holds the European Master in Software Engineering, and his research work focuses on Requirements Engineering. He works at Axis Communications as a software engineer, and as a Master Thesis supervisor and coordinator. Baldvin Gislason Bern works as a test engineer at Axis Communications, with focus on test strategies, process improvements and applied research.

title: Make sense of your (big) data
subTitle: ElasticSearch meetup
description: We are happy to announce our very first meetup in Malmö Sweden! Join us for an evening of Elasticsearch fun with our own Honza Kral. Agenda: 16.30 - Drinks and networking 17.00 - Make sense of your (big) data using Elasticsearch - Honza Kral In this talk I would like to show you a few real-life use-cases where Elasticsearch can help you make sense of your data. We will start with the most basic use case of searching your unstructured data and move on to more advanced topics such as faceting, aggregations and structured search. I would like to demonstrate that the very same tool and dataset can be used for real-time analytics as well as the basis for your more advanced data processing jobs. All in a distributed environment capable of handling terabyte-sized datasets. All examples will be shown with real data and python code demoing the new libraries we have been working on to make this process easier. 17.30 - Amazing Log Management with Elasticsearch and Kibana in .NET - Emil Cardell Elasticsearch and Kibana is an easy to use open source stack that gives us both great aggregation and search capabilities with a user friendly UI. In this session we will use LogFlow, a .net replacement to LogStash, to move logs from disk to stunning visuals. If you haven’t seen Elasticsearch and Kibana before. Be prepare to be amazed. After the presentation: Beers and Pizza and mingle time! Speaker: Honza Kral - Elasticsearch Honza is a Python programmer and Django core developer – since he is scared of the bright and shiny world of browsers, designers, and users he prefers to stay buried deep in the infrastructure code and just provides others with tools to do the actual site-building. Since 2008 Honza has been building content web sites for fun and profit. During this time he discovered Elasticsearch which lead to him joining the company behind it in 2013 to work on the Python drivers. Speaker: Emil Cardell - Thomas Cook Northern Europe Always looking for ways to find developer happiness, he looks outside the box and works actively to encourage developers to step out of their comfort zone to grow their love for creating amazing web applications. He is engaged in the developer community, speaking at conferences and contributing to multiple open source projects. Emil Cardell has been working on large public websites, communities and intranets for more than a decade, currently at Thomas Cook in Stockholm. Twitter: @emilcardell Event sponsors

title: Divya Ostwal talks about Chance
subTitle: CreativeMornings
description: is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community. ABOUT THE SPEAKER Divya is a team coach, brand strategist and Google analyst at Good Old digital agency in Malmö. Over the last ten years Divya has juggled various roles in digital agencies and worked out of India & Singapore, before moving to Sweden four years ago. She thoroughly enjoys working in multi-cultural environments and believes in logic driven magic. She is also an avid traveller and an editorial photographer. Divya will talk to us about her bi-polar careers to explain the difference between Choice and Chance. The focus of the talk will be her latest photo series shot on the sets of a Bollywood movie that is being created into a commercial movie. ADDITIONAL DETAILS Doors open at 8am for breakfast fika, 20min talk begins at 8:20, with a chance for questions and networking afterwards before finishing at 9am. THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Show anything that works
subTitle: DemoDag
description: Demodag is originally an occasional Demo show in Copenhagen. We have now decided to do it in Malmö, for the third time, since it's a great opportunity for entrepreneurs to show their products and get feedback. We will begin with mingle and demo preparations at 17.30 - Presentations (Demos) starts at 18.00 Demos are: - 7 minutes of anything that works. Your product, your open source project, your hack from last night. - Anything goes, as long as you actually built it - No slideshows, just show us your thing. - It’s often software – but it doesn’t have to be! We like wood, plastic, electronics, software. As long as you made it It is always free to attend and it is always free to demo. We usually havea beer after. We usually film all the demos. You watch the ones from Copenhagen here: video.demodag.org. You can also watch videos from previous presentations from DemoDag Malmö in Foo Café's YouTube channel. Demodag was started by, and is MCed by, Claus Dahl in Copenhagen and Björn Söderqvist in Malmö. THIS EVENT IS CANCELLED DUE TO ILLNESS

title: Effektivisera din vardag med Evernote
subTitle: Media Talks Lunch
description: Media Talks är både en fysisk och online projekt för att höja kompetens och inspirera andra inom samhället och den Svenska näringen. Ämnen som vi kommer rikta oss på är allt inom ”Media och kommunikation”… som Internet, tryck, bild, video, kommunikation, sociala medier, marknadsföring och entreprenörskap. Vi börjar alltid med en presentation på ett aktuellt ämne för sedan äta en gemensam lunch. Presentation Vill du utnyttja webben bättre? Öka effektiviteten, få helhetsgrepp över livet, jobbet, verksamheten… Du får många tips om hur olika verktyg på webben kan användas både privat och i arbetet, med fokus på Evernote. Samla kunskap från ditt surfande i ett lätthanterligt system som du kommer åt överallt. Spara på miljön, skapa ett papperslös kontor som du alltid har med dig. Se varför Evernote är det bästa arkiverings- och researchverktyget på webben just nu. Föreläsningen innebär konkreta exempel på setup i Evernote, allt från grund till avancerat. - Evernote som databas - Anteckningsblock och idéfångare - Task manager - Verktyg för research - Integration mellan PC, Mac, iPhone, Android Talare Dragan ”Homesick Mac” Ruzic är en professionell musiker som älskar att göra allt (förutom själva musiken) snabbare, effektivare, för att kunna frigöra tid och resurser till att njuta av vardagen och musiken… Dragan har har använt Evernote sedan 2009 och i det har han allt sitt nätverk, arkivet över bokningar, kunskapsartiklar och en massa annat. Allt sorterat, lättåtkomligt på alla enheter. Dragan håller också på att skriva en e-book om hur man kan använda Evernote för att underlätta och inspirera. Detta koncept kan egentligen tillämpas i nästan alla branscher, oavsett om man är ensamföretagare eller om man arbetar i en större grupp. DETTA EVENTET ÄR FULLBOKAT

title: Safe and robust systems programming in Rust
subTitle: Rust Skåne
description: This is a RUST Skåne meet up We will begin with meet, greet, pizza and beer at 17.30 First presentation starts 18.00 Rust: The road to the imminent 1.0, Jakub Bukaj Rust is planned to see its first stable release in early 2015. We'll discuss what is coming up and how to get started with the language, its package manager and the thriving ecosystem. Safe multi-thread coordination in Rust, Jens Nockert Jens will tell us about writing multi-threaded code in Rust and how the language stops you from doing it in an unsafe fashion. We'll show case it by analysing the work unit and work queue machinery used by Servo, the most prominent project written in Rust.

title: TDD Practice Session
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: In an effort to help strengthen our TDD skills, ØSCG will be hosting our TDD pratice sessions more frequently. Louis Hansen will be the guide for the evening as we go through one (or perhaps more depending on how we fare) Katas. We will work in pairs and use cyber-dojo [http://cyber-dojo.org] as our environment. Everyone should try to bring a laptop. We will work in pairs so if you really cannot bring one there should be enough to go around. If you have any questions about how it works prior to the event please do not hesitate to send us a mail at our Google Group or a message at our LinkedIn group.

title: War story: Switching to Python
subTitle: Skåne Python UG
description: Besides being easy to learn and very expressive, Python is an extremely versatile language. It is used for everything from running on a chip, creating web applications, automating native applications, machine learning to analyzing scientific data. Imagine my horror when I found out that there is no Python user group in the Malmö/Lund area! This needs to be fixed as soon as possible! Let's kick off the Skåne Python User Group with a couple of short presentations about what we're using Python for; either at work or on our hobby projects. Nothing fancy, just be prepared to share something about what you're working on. If you're not actively working on anything with Python, and are just curious about the language that's perfectly fine! We'll also spend some time talking about what kind of content we'd like to create together in the future. See you there! Presentation: Switching to Python at Lundalogik During 2014 the LIME Pro team at Lundalogik has been making a switch from developing for Windows using C++ and .NET to using Python as our main platform for new development. This presentation brings up how and why we decided to make the switch, what our development infrastructure looks like, and the joys and sorrows of starting to use Python in a traditional Windows shop. Presenter: Joakim Karlsson, Lundalogik AB Joakim has tried most roles in software development. After a long time working as a consultant focusing on helping teams with agile methodologies, he's now back coding full time, mainly in Python. He's now part of the LIME Pro team at Lundalogik, where he works on developing the next generation of CRM systems. Event sponsor

title: A day with focus on mastering programming
subTitle: ØSCG Code Retreat
description: ØSCG welcomes you to a Code Retreat on Saturday the 6th of December. A Code Retreat is a day of practice where we will focus on improving our skills in design, tools and other things we rarely have time for in our day to day life. We will work on the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, self testing code and the four rules of simple design. The problem domain is Conway's Game of Life. We work in pairs. Each session is 45 minutes. Then we throw the code away and have a short retrospective. Next session starts with a new pairing partner. We will start with breakfast and introductions at 9:30am. The first session starts at 10:00am. Lunch break will be at 1:00pm. To make sure we have plenty of time to socialise and talk we will not start the afternoon sessions until 2:30pm. Expect to finish at about 6:00pm. Each participant should, ideally, bring their own laptop. If you cannot bring a laptop I'm sure there will be enough to go around. But to ensure there are enough computers it is important that everyone who can brings one. Each computer will need a fully functional development environment. The day is language agnostic but please choose a language and environment you feel comfortable with. If you want to learn more about a language you are not comfortable with you are free to partner with someone who is. For more detailed information on Code Retreats visit http://coderetreat.org/about Event sponsor

title: Consumers and the Internet of Things
subTitle: Internet of Me
description: Internet of Me, based on people's needs with the help of digital technology can be developed into services which also responds to the changing landscape of society and business. The initiative brings together individuals and companies who want to pursue this development. Internet of Me becomes a " boundary breakers " that moves between different industries and are looking for new opportunities that will benefit people's need and desire to contribute to the development of the Internet of me. It's the people who see the new opportunities that digitization brings. We want to work in this new field with an Agile approach that involves trial and error , testing , changes , and implements . As development takes place in a new and largely unknown land , there are no accepted truths of the success factors . Agenda 17.30-17.45 - Mingle 17.45-18.00 - Introduction of "Internet of Me" by Christer Månsson 18.00-18.30 - Consumers and the Internet of Things, Michael Björn, Head of Research Ericsson ConsumerLab & adjungerad professor vid Ekonomihögskolan, Lunds Universitet Increasingly, consumers expect the physical world to be as interactive as our sceens. Things should respond to touch and be able to handle information. 18.30-19.00 - Mingel, food and beer 19.00-20.00 - Short presentations on new opportunities from participants and discussion

title: Share your vision - Change the world
subTitle: Meet Malmö Startups
description: Hemlis and Malmö Startups invite you to an evening with Hemlis messenger. Get to know the startup, what got them started, who they are and what they do. [Meet Malmö Startup] is a series of informal events organised by Malmö Startups where we visit startups in Malmö and surroundings to get to know them better. The startups will share their visions, talk about their products or services and what they want to change in the world. We'll get to know the founders and the teams behind it; their roles, how they work and how the community can help them move forward. == Program == = Introduction of Hemlis = - Get to know the product, the founders and the team - The past, present and the future - Challenges - how can we help them succeed? - Q & A - Get beta access = Snacks & drinks = THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Tech-talker course
subTitle: MasterClass
description: When: Every Tuesday evening from 13 January to 17 February, 2015 (six sessions in total) Conducted by: Shu Liang Cost: Regular price 7.900 SEK / attendee (max 10 attendees) Including documentation and food/beverage on each evening. Tech-talker course A seminar-style workshop that develops your public-speaking skills for the benefit of work efficiency and interpersonal communication - something that you and your company/employees would benefit from! The fundamentals of public speaking will be presented in a relaxed and interactive atmosphere. In addition to learning, participants will get to prepare and deliver at least 3 speeches in front of the other participants. Sample course curriculum: #1 - Introduce the "House" Rule #2 - Structure is Clarity #3 - PEF Up the Content #4 - Effective Speaking #5 - Pay It Forward with Feedback #6 - TBD. Topics specific to technical /professional presentations. About Shu Liang Shu Liang is an experienced Toastmaster and has achieved the Distinguished Toastmaster (DTM) award. Shu has extensive work experience as an IT project manager in Canada and the Middle East in the energy, construction and banking fields. Shu recently served on the jury panel at the Øredev Speakers Challenge event hosted by the Foo Cafe. Her speaking signature is energy, focus and motivation. THIS COURSE IS FULLY BOOKED but you can signup to receive information about the next course opportunity. Please send an email to carina@foocafe.org to get more information.

title: Good artists copy; Great artists replicate
subTitle: Node Malmö
description: Let's talk about replication. Database replication is probably one of the most misunderstood things in computer science. I've been in various arguments with developers about how to replicate a database in a distributed system. Some argue that mongodb's way is the best. Some argue postgres. Some prefer emailing zips of database dumps around the office. In general, replication is a *really hard* problem. However, it is actually pretty simple if you are willing to accept some trade-offs. This talk will be about investigating how we can make replication simpler by building specialized databases that does fewer things. Using a bunch of small npm modules we'll build a database that supports multi master replication in a couple of 100 lines of code. Mathias was early in when it came to NodeJs and was using it as early as version 0.1.x. He is also a co-host of Copehagen Node Hackaton, the author of more than 200 modules on npm and was recently a guest on the podcast NodeUp. Event sponsor

title: David Cuartielles talks about Education
subTitle: CreativeMornings
description: is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community. ABOUT THE SPEAKER David Cuartielles is MSC. telecommunications engineer, leads the Prototyping Laboratory at Malmö University’s School of Arts and Communication, teaches interactive technologies, and is one of the co-founders of the open source platform Arduino. Currently David is working for the Medea research platform, writing his PhD. in prototyping tools for education, supervising the Arduino web-structure, and teaching several courses. ADDITIONAL DETAILS Doors open at 8am for breakfast fika, 20min talk begins at 8:20, with a chance for questions and networking afterwards before finishing at 9am. Event sponsor THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Använda sociala medier som valuta?
subTitle: Social Media Club
description: Kan man verkligen ta betalt med en tweet? Och kan man betala sitt hotellrum med en facebook incheckning? I dag finns det lösningar för hantering av sociala medier som valuta, men funkar det? Kan man använda det till vad som helst? Du är välkommen att vare med Social Media Club Skåne och diskutera sociala medier som valuta. Agenda 11.30 - 11.50 Introduktion till ämnet 11.50 - 12.30 Fortsatt gemensam diskussion och frågor Social Media Club Skåne är en ideell nätverksgrupp som träffas en gång i månaden för att diskutera sociala medier. Inga krav, inga förpliktelser. Det viktiga är att vi vill träffas och diskutera sociala medier med likasinnade. Social Media Club är en internationell non-profit organisation grundad i USA av Chris Heuer och Kristie Wells i mars 2006. Mottot är ”if you get, share it” och det är just vad det handlar om, att dela med sig av kunskap, tankar och idéer om sociala medier. Vill du veta mer om den internationella organisationen kan du läsa mer på deras hemsida socialmediaclub.org.

title: Från värk till värdefull investering - test blir en ekonomisk framgång
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: Förebyggande insatser för att slippa besöket hos tandläkaren är alltid de svåraste att motivera. Det gör ju inte ont än. Ändå vet vi att tandvärk är både smärtsamma och dyra. Precis samma situation hamnar alltför många företag i som prioriterar ner test och kvalitetssäkring av sina IT-system. Teoretiskt vet man att kostnaden för att rätta en bugg blir exponentiellt mycket dyrare desto senare buggen hittas. Ändå väntar man. Och man ser testprocessen som en kostnad när den borde ses som en besparing. En av de största anledningarna är svårigheten att kvantifiera den kommande besparingen. Så, hur gör vi? Hur kan vi mäta kostnader orsakad av låg kvalitet? Och hur kan vi motivera den investering som krävs för att uppnå förväntad kvalitet? I det här föredraget diskuterar Eric Järdemar olika sätt att mäta och delar med sig av konkreta case där kunden blivit övertygade om vikten av test. Talare Eric Järdemar är automationsingenjör med mer än tio års erfarenhet av test och kvalitetssäkring i olika roller. Idag arbetar han som Delivery Manager på System Verification med fokus på teststrategier. Genom åren har han bland annat hjälpt kunder som CSC, BorgWarner, Securitas och E.ON att utforma effektiva strategier för test. Eric Järdemar är en stor förespråkare av agila metoder och själv en erfaren användare av SCRUM. Agenda 17.30-18.00 - Mingle med något enkelt att äta 18.00-19.00 - Presentation & Diskussion 19.00- …… - mer mingle och diskussion

title: A peek at Kotlin
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: Kotlin, a new statically typed language from JetBrains, just reached a new milestone (M10). The language itself is good news for everyone who wants to write code where interoperability with Java is a requirement. Right now, Kotlin can be compiled both into JVM bytecode and Javascript. In this talk, we'll take a look at the syntax and various idioms in Kotlin. We'll also talk about collections such as lists and maps, and how to apply operations to them in a functional way. Some of the things this talk will cover: Object orientation: Classes and properties Extension methods, lambdas and higher order programming Collections and functional programming Intended audience This talk is for developers who are interested in Kotlin. No prior experience in Kotlin is needed. However, it will be assumed that you are familiar with object orientation and to some degree functional programming in terms of closures/lambdas and higher-order programming. About the teacher Eric is working as a teacher and software consultant at Edument. At work, he writes code in several languages, but mainly C# and various scripting languages. In his spare time, he works on 3D rendering in C++. He's an agile proponent who believes in writing clean, simple and efficient code over picking a certain framework over another.

title: Because one learns more from failure than success
subTitle: FuckUp Nights
description: What is FuckUp Nights A monthly event series where fuckupreneurs talk about their biggest professional or business failure in an irreverent and candid way.   It started as a hobby in Mexico City and went out of control to be replicated all around the world. FuckUp Nights is already present in 64 cities and 25 countries around the Globe including Copenhagen, Stockholm and Malmö. Why We Do It · Because one learns more from failure than success. · Because we were fed up with simplistic and unrealistic stories of overnight success. · Because the first time we did it our lives were changed, and we want to share the experience with you. How In each FuckUp Night 3 or 4 fuckupreneurs share their stories of failure including: • What was their project? • What did they do wrong? • What did they learn? • What would they do differently? At the end of each story the audience asks questions. All accompanied by beer and good friends. Facebook: hyperurl.co/funmalmo “Failure sucks but instructs” THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Let's improve our events together
subTitle: Community Builders' Event
description: This is a special event for organizers of interest and user groups. Some of you have put on loads of events and some of you are noobs. We would like to welcome everybody to this event so that we can together share our experience in producing events and by doing so they will be better. The event will be done in four different ways so we will both talk about different events while at the same time produce the events during the evening. Agenda - Who's who at the event? - Workshop - your experiences will be summarized in this workshop led by Björn Granvik - Presenting the workshop result with discussions led by Henrik Andersson - Break - with pizza and beer - Tips and tricks - Foo Café experiences presented by Michael Tiberg About the presenters Björn Granvik has long experience in putting on workshops from various consultancy and product companies. Perviously, he managed the Java User Group in Malmö for many years. Henrik Andersson organizes a yearly conference besides his daily job as CEO. He also manages the Test User Group - ConTest here in Malmö Michael Tiberg is the founder of Foo Café Event sponsors

title: UX - Don't make them think!
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: What is the key to making a website valuable for users? What fundamentals do we need to understand? This event covers three important foundations for the successful collecting and sharing of knowledge on a website so people can take their own decisions. First - Structure your data in a natural way Data on its own is pointless. What matters is the information and intelligence that is derived from it. How easy it is to derive such understandings from data depends on how the data is structured. When learning new things, we form an understanding of it by relating it to things we already know. Structuring your data by how things are connected will give you a better understanding of your information, and help you create a better experience for your users. Tobias Lindaaker is a software engineer and technical mentor at Neo Technology. Tobias has several years of experience with structuring, modelling and storing data, as well as retrieving data, and making sense of it. Second - The power of Words Before it was the pen, now it’s the keyboard, that’s mightier than the sword. Paul Steele will explain how using the right words at the right time will encourage people to read your instructions, buy from your website and answer your call to action. Paul has been working as a copywriter for many years, helping companies such as Sony Mobile, Tetra Pak, Alfa Laval, Assa Abloy and Sandvik Mining tell their customers how good their products and services really are. Third - A happier user How are we supposed to create digital services that add value and solve real-world problems? Employing some pragmatic, jargon-less reasoning helps to you to see the wood for the trees and helps to achieve a better end result. Henno Gous shares some thoughts about simple methods that save time, frustration and money and reveals questions that he believes are valuable to ask at the outset of a digital project. Henno is a project manager at Odd Hill in Malmö. He is originally from South Africa and has a background in industrial engineering, innovation management and research. The presentations will be followed by a discussion between speakers and attendees. THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: TDD Practice Session
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: In an effort to help strengthen our TDD skills, ØSCG will be hosting our TDD pratice sessions more frequently. Pavel Rozenblioum will be the guide for the evening as we go through one (or perhaps more depending on how we fare) Katas. We will work in pairs and use cyber-dojo [http://cyber-dojo.org] as our environment. Everyone should try to bring a laptop. We will work in pairs so if you really cannot bring one there should be enough to go around. If you have any questions about how it works prior to the event please do not hesitate to send us a mail at our Google Group or a message at our LinkedIn group.

title: Marie Louise Kold talks about Ugly
subTitle: CreativeMornings
description: is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community. ABOUT THE SPEAKER Marie Louise Kold is Danish and creates metal art for a living. She is based in Malmö, Sweden and in Malta. She has developed techniques of her own, imbuing the metals copper, bronze and brass with an emotional charge that turns them into art. Her first years as a full time artist consisted of incessant work, but nothing to show for it. Over the past decade, with tenacity, strategy and a massive passion for what she does, Marie Louise has gone on to make an international name for herself and her art. Marie Louise will talk about how she turns “ugly” materials into beautiful, vibrant art using her unusual techniques. However, the main focus of the talk will be on how the unavoidable (and generally ugly) financial side of making a living off your art can be handled successfully – and made pretty – without compromising either art or integrity.“ ADDITIONAL DETAILS Doors open at 8am for breakfast fika, 20min talk begins at 8:20, with a chance for questions and networking afterwards before finishing at 9am.

title: Because one learns more from failure than success
subTitle: FuckUp Nights
description: What is FuckUp Nights A monthly event series where fuckupreneurs talk about their biggest professional or business failure in an irreverent and candid way.   It started as a hobby in Mexico City and went out of control to be replicated all around the world. FuckUp Nights is already present in 64 cities and 25 countries around the Globe including Copenhagen, Stockholm and Malmö. Why We Do It · Because one learns more from failure than success. · Because we were fed up with simplistic and unrealistic stories of overnight success. · Because the first time we did it our lives were changed, and we want to share the experience with you. How In each FuckUp Night 3 or 4 fuckupreneurs share their stories of failure including: • What was their project? • What did they do wrong? • What did they learn? • What would they do differently? At the end of each story the audience asks questions. All accompanied by beer and good friends. Facebook: hyperurl.co/funmalmo “Failure sucks but instructs” THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: A World-changing step: Open hardware
subTitle: Dataföreningen
description: Prior approaches in hardware design were characterized by being proprietary, which limited the number of people who had the resources to design and produce customized hardware solutions. Open source hardware is a world-changing step in order to break this barrier. Open source hardware has given an opportunity to a broad number of users to use small and affordable programmable boards, create tangible results and become part of this creative world. In this talk we will focus on programmable boards like Arduino and Raspberry Pi. Open source hardware can be used to sense our environment, analyze the information that this environment contains, and proceed to interfere with the environment, closing the loop. Moreover, these devices can access the Internet and become both new information clients and information providers! Many examples of programs will be shown. Didac Gil will speak in English but the discussion and questions can be made in Swedish or English. Didac Gil de la Iglesia is a research fellow in Media Technology at Linnaeus University in Vaxjö. He holds a Master degree title in Mobile telecommunications by Polytechnic University of Catalunya and a PhD in Computer Science by Linnaeus University. He teaches about Open Hardware solutions for the creation of Tangible User Interfaces.

title: Gamification - how experiencing brain learning games create motivation
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: – to enhance learning and motivation, getting the customer hooked and the brain involved. What is it that immediately attracts users and customers to a product, a website or a campaign? And what makes them want to come back, learn more, and stay as customers? It is all about what happens in the Brain – a minds game. Your brain automatically knows what it likes and quickly gets bored if it doesn’t get what it wants. If you want to attract users /customers, you will need to intuitively know what basic principles the customers brains are following, or, you will need to learn about them and adapt your product or presentation accordingly. Associate professor and neuroscientist Magnus Sjögren from Edubrain AB demonstrates some of the principles that the brain follows, how it involves motivation and relationship building, and how gamification serves to reinforce these. Magnus presents to you some of the keys you need to build long-term relationships through enhanced learning, participation and improve retention, influencing your customers. THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Code Review
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: Code review is one of the most important tools in a software craftsman's arsenal. Today we will be presenting 2 short talks about code review. Presentation 1 What happens when code review is introduced in a team that didn't use it before? In this talk Pavel will talk about his experience introducing code review in his team and discuss various challenges Speaker 1 Pavel Rozenblioum is a Senior Java Developer at Jayway. Before that he spent 7 years as a Java EE developer at Tetra Pak. Presentation 2 Hierarchical community software development: what would it be without a code review? This presentation will cover the biggest and the most established hierarchical software development community, that is, the Linux Kernel community and describe how code management is organized there in the hierarchical order. The stress will be made on the importance of code reviews for such organization. Speaker 2 Vitaly Wool is a Senior Embedded Specialist at Softprise Consulting OÜ, with the primary assignment as lead power optimization engineer at Sony Mobile

title: Influens, Påverkan och Objektivitet
subTitle: ConTest
description: Test tillhandahåller vid rätt tidpunkt våra intressenter med relevant, begriplig och värdefull kvalitets relaterad information. Med information är det lätt att påverka andra i olika riktningar. Det är ett tungt ansvar vi har. När är det rätt att påverka och när ska man inte göra det. Går det för oss att inte influera andra och vara helt objektiva i vår information, är det det som är vår uppgift? Kom och dela med er av era erfarenheter om detta. När och hur har ni haft nytta av influens samt när har det gått galet. Vad innebär objektivitet och hur använder vi vår möjlighet att påverka på ett förnuftigt sätt?

title: DevOps for the Enterprise
subTitle: Breakfast seminar
description: We will begin with mingle and a lighter breakfast at 07.30 Presentation starts 08.00 In this session the concepts of DevOps will be thoroughly presented to gain a common understanding of what it is an what it isn't. Then we will dive into the technical implications the introduction of DevOps in an organization have on your application architecture. As an example I will show how well fitted Java EE is for DevOps compared to other alternatives. The objectives of this session are: 1. Demystify DevOps 2. Technical implications of DevOps 3. Evaluate Java EE with DevOps in mind Speaker Ivar Grimstad is an experienced software architect focusing on Enterprise Java. He is member of the Java Community Process and in the Expert Groups for JSR 371 (MVC 1.0) and JSR 375 (Java EE Security API). He has been working with Java since the beginning and has over the years tried out everything from lightweight mobile applications to large scale enterprise applications. His experience covers all aspects of designing architectures based on a variety of technologies including standard Java EE as well as more lightweight frameworks such as Spring and a variety of open source products. Ivar is always focusing on quality and on using the right tools and technologies for the right task to optimize the software development process. Ivar is a frequent speaker at conferences, locally as well as internationally.

title: Polymer Polytechnic
subTitle: Hackathon
description: More than semantic elements, less than unicorns ABOUT POLYMER Web Components are a new set of emerging standards that allow developers to extend the web platform by creating their own HTML elements. Imagine if the web had its own mobile SDK, and building a web application meant wiring together well encapsulated components with scoped CSS. That’s the future Web Components will bring about. And using a library like Polymer, we can actually start building projects that leverage these future technologies, today! Polymer does two things: – It polyfills Web Components in modern browsers that lack support (IE 10+, Safari 6+, Mobile Safari), this means you can create projects that use Web Components and actually run them cross browser. – It adds features to the browser which are not part of the Web Components standards, but make working with Web Components easier. These features include data-binding, gesture support, property observation, and a clean, declarative syntax for creating new components. ABOUT POLYTECHNIC Polymer Polytechnic is an event series of in-person, community-run events to help developers learn Polymer. These events are run by local Google Developer Groups or other developer meetups all over the world. Each event is a little different, but generally, Polymer Polytechnic can include a tech talk, series of code labs, and time for personal hacking. Food and drinks will be provided. Agenda 08:30 Breakfast and coffee 09:00 Introductory presentation 10:00 Coffee break 10:15 Polymer basics 10:35 Workshop: First application 11:20 Coffee break 11:35 Workshop: Google maps 12:15 Lunch 13:15 Workshop: Code your dream 17:00 Outro and beer 18:00 Post-polytechnic mingle beer elsewhere? Hosts Glenn Jorde - consultant / web developer @ tregusti.com. Currently building an online game @ casinosaga.com. Balázs Suhajda - consultant / interface developer @ tretton37. The event will be held in English. Event sponsor

title: Winning elections with Python and Django
subTitle: Skåne Python UG
description: Welcome to the second instalment of Skåne Python User Group. Our first meeting was jam packed, and we're going to continue our war stories so we can get to know each other a little bit better. We'll also add a new agenda item - standard module of the day. Besides presentations there will of course be plenty of time to mingle and meet other Python developers. Winning elections with Python and Django In september the Malmö branch of political party Vänsterpartiet got it's highest results ever in the local elections, due in part to an in-house tool for organizing large-scale activism. Richard Olsson will tell us about the experiences of using Python and the Django framework in an iterative process to build a tool for political change. Richard Olsson Richard is a freelance developer and "hacktivist" who in 2013 and 2014 took one year of from client work to focus on poltiics and use his powers for good. Module of the day: Packaging with setuptools Ok, this might or might not count as a standard module depending on what version of Python you're running, but since Python 3.4 packaging is finally included out of the box. I'll run through a quick demo of - creating and publishing a python package - adding plugins and dependencies - adding custom commands for things like running tests and checking code style - (if time) add an extension module and compile it as part of building the package Joakim Karlsson, Lundalogik Joakim has tried most roles in software development. After a long time working as a consultant focusing on helping teams with agile methodologies, he's now back coding full time, mainly in Python. He's now part of the LIME Pro team at Lundalogik, where he works on developing the next generation of CRM systems. Event sponsor

title: Practical TDD - mechanics and  intent
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: Productivity decreases when code rots. Code rots because we are afraid to clean it. By practicing TDD you can gain executable documentation, loosely coupled components and a safety net that keeps you from being afraid. This session, led by TDD trainer Sebastian Larsson, will go through the inner mechanics of TDD. Practical examples of how to develop using TDD will be demonstrated along with resources for learning more about TDD. Participants will pair up and take part in practical exercises, so it is encouraged but not required to bring a laptop. The session is appropriate for both new and experienced developers in TDD. Speaker Sebastian Larsson is an aspiring software craftsman who works as a consultant for Cybercom Karlskrona. He spends his workdays at Försäkringskassan IT as a java developer, working on the self service portal. A significant portion of his non-working days are spent practicing practical coding skills like TDD, refactoring and design principles. Sebastian is a certified trainer for ISQi's Certified Agile TDD course and a strong believer in the Software Craftsmanship movement.

title: Python-programmering för barn och ungdomar
subTitle: Patwic
description: Patwic vill ge alla chansen att lära sig koda. Vi ser oss som folkbildare och vi är helt övertygade om att alla människor utvecklas av att lära sig programmering och informationsmodellering. I Patwic får eleverna lära sig att programmera i Python, jobba med Linux, integrera tjänster med JSON, publicera innehåll med Markdown och HTML, analysera enkla protokoll som IRC, jobba med debugging och hantera data med Git och Bitbucket. Laborationerna är utformade efter ”Learn to code, code to learn” devisen där syftet är att eleverna skall använda sina tekniska färdigheter för att undersöka problem hämtade från skolämnen, lingvistik och givetvis Internet. Sponsor:

title: WooCommerce - din nästa e-handelsplattform?
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: FRUKOSTSEMINARIET ÄR INSTÄLLT Välkommen till ett inspirerande och lärorikt frukostseminarium på temat e-handels- lösningar på open source med oss på NetRelations. Under morgonen ger våra systemutvecklare och WordPress-experter Pontus Abrahamsson och Mikko Lauhakari dig inblick i vilka möjligheter som finns på WooCommerce och hjälper dig att reda ut varför det är plattformen för din nästa e-handelslösning! WooCommerce är ett e-handelsplugin till WordPress som lanserades i september 2011 och därefter har vuxit till att 2014 bli den största e-handelsplattformen i världen. Under morgonen berättar vi om: - Statistik, trender och allmän info om WooCommerce - ”Från produkt till order” – demo av hur ett flöde ser ut i WooCommerce - ”Externa befintliga system, inga problem!” – WooCommerce flexibilitet avseende integrationer - Betallösningar – vilka möjligheter finns det att använda olika varianter? - Exempel på sajter som använder WooCommerce idag Agenda 07:30-08:00 Registrering och frukost (kaffe, te, macka och juice) 08:00-08.50 Föreläsning 08:50-09:00 Frågestund Talare: Pontus Abrahamsson Pontus arbetar som systemutvecklare hos oss på NetRelations och har en gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga såväl intranät som komplexa webbplatser på WordPress. Pontus har arbetat med WordPress sedan 2007 och innehar idag en imponerande 5:e plats i Code Poets WordPress-quiz (http://codepoet.com/quiz/). Pontus brinner lite extra för att skapa webbplatser som är lika enkla att administrera som att besöka. Mikko Lauhakari Precis som Pontus arbetar Mikko som systemutvecklare hos oss på NetRelations och har arbetat med WordPress i ca 6 år, både med administration av innehåll och kodning av teman/plugins. Mikko har en bakgrund i bemanningsbranschen där han ansvarat för att bygga WordPress-lösningar i form av konsultportaler och funktioner för tidsrapportering. Mikkos webbintresse sträcker sig över ett stort spektrum, från design och kodning av gränssnitt och utveckling av systemen bakom till själva innehållet. FRUKOSTSEMINARIET ÄR INSTÄLLT

title: TDD practice session
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: ØSCG is continuing to try and expand our knowledge of, and experience with, Test Driven Development (TDD). Our monthly TDD practice session is an effort to achieve this goal and strengthen not only our skills but also our community. Come and join us for a fun evening of coding and learning with Louis Hansen guiding us through working with TDD. Since this is a practice session that involves hands-on work it is preferable if each participant has their own laptop, however we will be working in pairs so if you do not have a laptop to bring then please don't be discouraged. If you have any questions about how it works prior to the event please do not hesitate to send us a mail at our Google Group or a message at our LinkedIn group.

title: Better UI and business logic with MVVM
subTitle: Malmö Droid
description: Malmö Droid is a group of developers and tech enthusiasts passionate about Android. We get together monthly to share knowledge about developing for the Android Platform. Everybody interested in the Green Robot is welcome. We begin with meet and greet. Presentation starts at 17.45. There will be a break for something lighter to eat during the evening. Presentation How Podio do the MVVM pattern as well as how we do feature flipping in our app. Speaker: Tobias Lindberg studied Computer Science and Engineering at LTH in Lund and graduated 2010 with the exception of studying one year 2007 - 2008 at Czech Technical University in Prague. 2010 - 2011 worked in Stockholm for a small app consultancy firm called Harbour Front were among others I made SJs android app. 2011 - 2012 worked as on site consultant at Sony Ericsson (they turned to Sony Mobile while I was there) where I worked in their widget team. Since May 2012 is working at Podio.

title: Johan Berhin talks about Climate
subTitle: CreativeMornings
description: is a breakfast lecture series for the creative community. ABOUT THE SPEAKER Johan Berhin is designer and founder at Green Furniture Sweden, producers of sustainable design furniture for public indoor landscapes. As well as design and production of their own furniture, they host the annual Green Furniture Awards, and started the Lowtox Living initiative. Passionate about design and sustainability, Johan’s studio is a leader in sustainable furniture concepts. He will be sharing his green success story and discussing the fallacy that sustainability and profitability has to be a trade-off. ADDITIONAL DETAILS Doors open at 8am for breakfast fika, 20min talk begins at 8:20, with a chance for questions and networking afterwards before finishing at 9am.

title: Effektivisera din vardag med Evernote del 2 - avancerad
subTitle: Media Talks Lunch
description: Media Talks är både en fysisk och online projekt för att höja kompetens och inspirera andra inom samhället och den Svenska näringen. Ämnen som vi kommer rikta oss på är allt inom ”Media och kommunikation”… som Internet, tryck, bild, video, kommunikation, sociala medier, marknadsföring och entreprenörskap. Vi börjar alltid med en presentation på ett aktuellt ämne för sedan äta en gemensam lunch. Presentation Djupgående om inställningar i Evernote och Web Clipper. Om bästa sätt att använda Web Clipper inom media Integration mellan Evernote och andra applikationer (t.ex. HootSuite, Todoist) Hur fungerar WorkChatt, den nya funktionen i Evernote? Hur konfigurera Notebooks och Stacks på bästa sätt för just din verksamhet Maila in information till Evernote på ett effektivare sätt Hur använda "Table Of Content” i Evernote mest effektivt? Att konfigurera Evernotes Presentation Mode Talare Dragan ”Homesick Mac” Ruzic är en professionell musiker som älskar att göra allt (förutom själva musiken) snabbare, effektivare, för att kunna frigöra tid och resurser till att njuta av vardagen och musiken… Dragan har har använt Evernote sedan 2009 och i det har han allt sitt nätverk, arkivet över bokningar, kunskapsartiklar och en massa annat. Allt sorterat, lättåtkomligt på alla enheter. Dragan håller också på att skriva en e-book om hur man kan använda Evernote för att underlätta och inspirera. Detta koncept kan egentligen tillämpas i nästan alla branscher, oavsett om man är ensamföretagare eller om man arbetar i en större grupp.

title: Creative Workflow i Adobe CC
subTitle: Media Talks Lunch
description: Media Talks är både en fysisk och online projekt för att höja kompetens och inspirera andra inom samhället och den Svenska näringen. Ämnen som vi kommer rikta oss på är allt inom ”Media och kommunikation”… som Internet, tryck, bild, video, kommunikation, sociala medier, marknadsföring och entreprenörskap. Vi börjar alltid med en presentation på ett aktuellt ämne för sedan äta en gemensam lunch. Presentation Att kunna retuschera bilder för webben eller sammanställa en trycksak, är idag en stor del av den moderna arbetsflödet. Föreläsningen omfattar grund - mellannivå designkoncept, verktyg och teknik och är idealisk för både nya Adobe-användare eller självlärda som vill befästa sina kunskaper och lära sig användbara tips. Några exempel på föreläsningens innehåll är hur man arbetar effektivt med snabbmask, innehållsmedveten och länkade bilder i Photoshop… övertoningar och kreativa effekter i InDesign samt förvrängd omslag, konturlinjer och banhanteraren i Illustrator. Vi kommer även titta på hur man skapar och sparar egna penslar samt en del nyheter, några bortglömda smarta funktioner samt kreativa tips & trix. Talare David Klein är medieentreprenör och är en av landets mest erfaren utbildare inom Adobes program sedan 20 år och driver utbildningsföretaget Grafiska Akademin i Malmö. David har även egen reklamverksamhet där han arbetar som varumärkesdesigner samt är grundaren till Media Talks och konferensen Internet i fokus.

title: Because one learns more from failure than success
subTitle: FuckUp Nights
description: What is FuckUp Nights A monthly event series where fuckupreneurs talk about their biggest professional or business failure in an irreverent and candid way.   It started as a hobby in Mexico City and went out of control to be replicated all around the world. FuckUp Nights is already present in 64 cities and 25 countries around the Globe including Copenhagen, Stockholm and Malmö. Why We Do It · Because one learns more from failure than success. · Because we were fed up with simplistic and unrealistic stories of overnight success. · Because the first time we did it our lives were changed, and we want to share the experience with you. How In each FuckUp Night 3 or 4 fuckupreneurs share their stories of failure including: • What was their project? • What did they do wrong? • What did they learn? • What would they do differently? At the end of each story the audience asks questions. All accompanied by beer and good friends. Facebook page “Failure sucks but instructs” THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Better tool - better code
subTitle: AW Seminar
description: How do you develop business applications for web? Johan Broddfelt is an experienced php-developer seriously considering using DataFlex as the sole tool for building web applications. Why? Because the DataFlex Studio has a really good framework for developing business applications for web. But it goes beyond that: The DataFlex Studio represents a complete paradigm shift, providing you with the means and the power for web developing even if you come from a database background and are not an experienced web developer yourself. In other words: The architecture of developing web applications with DataFlex Studio ensures that you can concentrate on developing solid applications without having to get tangled up in boring scripting, code smells and bit counting. All you have to do is code. Simply code. It’s clean, simple and powerful. It’s DataFlex. The look and feel is just like desktop applications and it is pure web! But don’t just take our word for it – see for yourself: Come and join Johan in a discussion where he compares DataFlex with PHP and get a short introduction as to how to deal with DataFlex. Feel free to bring your own favorite developing tool(s)! We would love to have some other developing languages and tools present in order to get a fair and balanced tool comparison. If you want to develop your own application or if you are considering which platform to choose for your next project be sure to join this presentation.

title: Inaugural Meetup and drinks
subTitle: Internet of Things Malmö
description: First Meetup for IoT Malmö and Skåne region! Lots of potential and interesting developments here in Skåne in the areas of Cloud, Mobile and the Internet of Things. Our first meet and greet will include presentations, discussions and opportunities to mingle with the passionate people who will design, implement and use our future connected devices Schedule 17:30 Doors open, mingle, grab some drinks and snacks 18:00 First speaker: Johan Strömhage CEO Purple Scout AB, producer of Binocular, a SaaS and server logic solution for IoT implementations: http://www.binocular.se/. Will talk about their platform, solution and how Purple Scout envisions IoT. 18:30 Break and drinks 18:45 Second speaker: David Cuartilles Co-founder of the Arduino platform: http://arduino.cc , Teacher at Malmo University: http://www.nav.mah.se/person/id/K3DACU He will talk about how he sees IoT, why he made arduino and what he does with Arduino Verkstad Malmö http://local.arduino.cc/malmo/ 19:15+ Presentations end. Networking, discussions, mingling. Tips • Bring your ideas for upcoming meetup discussion theme • Bring business cards OR be very cutting edge and bring a QR-code for LinkedIn or contact details. THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Konsten att sälja
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Vi börjar med enkel frukost 07.30 och presentationen börjar 08.00 Försäljning är nyckeln till framgång för dom som har ...  - en bra produkt? - en bra tjänst? - en bra affärsidé? Har du funderingar på hur du ska ... - hitta kunder? - boka möten med kunder? - få en kund att köpa din produkt eller tjänst?   Kom då på detta frukostseminariet så ger vi dig tips och idéer, som kommer att ta din försäljning till en ny nivå. Du får en spännande föreläsning om konsten att utvecklas som säljare och du får ta del av några av de principer som de mest framgångsrika säljarna använder.   Föreläsare Zaiga och Thomas Magnusson har mer än 20 års erfarenhet av försäljning och retorik från Electrolux, Toshiba, McDonalds, Sigma, etc. Zaiga och Thomas har bägge blivit prisbelönta för sina erfarenheter genom Dale Carnegie. >

title: Beauty In Code
subTitle: Conference
description: A day about software development with world-class speakers! Good code is an intricate play between technologies, people and organizations. To succeed, we need to master all aspects. That's why we've invited speakers that cover all these facets of modern software development. In one day, you will get to listen to seven speakers from seven countries: James Bach - How to Build an Analyst Adam Tornhill - Software design, team work and other man-made disasters Hadi Hariri - The Silver Bullet Syndrome Aslam Khan - Beauty is not perfect Anders Bjørnestad - When the infrastructure is just a code artifact Mark Seemann - Type-Driven Development Jim Webber - Five Little Things The registration fee (SEK 300) includes breakfast, lunch and afternoon coffee. For detailed info and registration: http://beautyincode.se/ PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS CONFERENCE TAKES PLACE AT SLAGTHUSET, MALMÖ

title: Tackling Legacy Code
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: Pretty much everyone in the software industry have encountered legacy code. Most have found the encounter a rather scary experience. This is an opportunity to lessen that feeling next time it happens. During this session of ØSCG we will focus on how we as craftsmen can help our customers deal with a legacy codebase. Starting with a clearer definition of what legacy code actually is, we will look at some of our options. From ignoring or deleting it to improving the codebase. After the introduction by Tomas Malmsten we will have the opportunity to share of our own experiences from working with legacy code. About the speaker Tomas Malmsten is the founder of ØSCG and a senior consultant at Webstep. He is a software craftsman with 15+ years experience who has stopped being afraid of legacy code. He has found that as the fear is replaced by respect and knowledge it can actually be quite rewarding and interesting to work with legacy code.

title: Lär dig programmera spel och bygga robotar
subTitle: Geek Girl mini
description: Foto: Anna Gerdén Nu arrangerar Geek Girl Meetup för första gången Geek Girl Mini i Malmö. Träffen vänder sig till unga tjejer (9-16 år) som gillar att skapa och vill lära sig mer om teknik och kod. Första Geek Girl Meetup hölls i Stockholm 2008. Geek Girl Meetup Öresund har haft regelbundna träffar sedan 2010. Syftet är att skapa nya nätverk och lyfta fram kvinnliga förebilder i teknikbranschen. Och ha kul så klart. Vem: Tjejer 9-16 år, utan föräldrar från aktivitetsstart kl 13:30. Vad: 13:15 - 13:30 – Introduktion till eftermiddagen 13:30 - 14:45 – Introduktion till programmering med Scratch 14:45 - 15:15 – Fika 15:15 - 16:45 – Ritande robotar 16:45 - 17:00 – Avrunding Begränsat antal platser. Anmälan senast den 23 februari. Om ni har några frågor, maila marie.gustafsson@gmail.com DETTA EVENTET ÄR FULLBOKAT

title: Microsoft Azure Camp for Startups
subTitle: Workshop
description: Building applications optimized for public cloud platforms are a little different compared to before. We review some common technical challenges for applications and recurring patterns of challenges we see within modern construction. During the session you will get information about which services in Microsoft Azure can simply and powerfully take care of these challenges and turn your application into a fast, agile and powerful construction with shorter delivery times and secure, stable production environments. This camp is meant to be interactive so prepare your questions. The maximum number of participants will be 30 Speakers: Dag König, Microsoft, is a developer that have been writing code since 1986. Since 2006 do Dag work for Microsoft Sweden as a Technical Evangelist. Dag still like to learn new stuff, and feel that he still is a beginner in many ways. Today he work mainly with Microsoft Azure and Open Source. Magnus Mårtensson runs Martensson Consulting as an expert and advisor and aids his clients in fulfilling their dreams in the Cloud. From Microsoft Magnus recently got the title Regional Director (RD) to add to Most Valuable Professional (MVP), Insider and Advisor for the Azure Platform. He is an international speaker and an organizer of community conferences such as CloudBurst and GlobalAzure. His online alias: @noopman. We focus on developers in Startups, so you should have tested Azure. Here is a trial You can also apply to join BizSpark and get Azure for one month free (worth $750 free)

title: Experiences from an Agile change leader
subTitle: Agile Manager’s Corner
description: Are you a manager in an organisation taking the plunge into the murky agile waters or are you perhaps a manager in an organisation that is sailing smoothly on the calm agile ocean? Do you have some great experiences to share or some dilemmas you would like to get some help with, something not sitting right with you? Would you like to get some new perspectives on managing in an agile context from others just like you? Visit Agile Manager’s Corner and talk to, get inspired by and get hands-on advice from other managers in the same situation. Session 2: Experiences from an Agile change leader Sven Carlstedt will share their experiences of going from an agile software team into an agile organization. During his years as head of department, head of project management and agile change manager at ST-Ericsson and Ericsson, he has accumulated experience from several initiatives of introducing an agile approach. Agile Manager's fundaments are: Purpose To help managers involved in agile or lean transitions to become successful in their new environment. Principles By managers, for managers The Agile Managers Corner is where managers meet to help and inspire each other to understand and evolve their role in an agile or lean environment. If you’re not in a managing role with responsibility for people you should find another corner to stand in. Changing by doing No matter how much we think, read or talk nothing changes unless we also act. It is important to have the courage to step out of our comfort zones and try something different - Agile Manager’s Corner is the place to share those stories, good or bad ones! It’s all about people Great people delivers great results and it is the manager’s responsibility to create an environment where people are allowed to be great. It is also important to remember that manager’s are people too!” Upcoming Topics Meetings - more or less, better or worse in an agile way of working? Group Dynamics - more important in an agile environment? Management 3.0 - hype or help? THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: ReactJS for front-end development
subTitle: Malmö FrontBox
description: Malmö FrontBox, it's the place where you pick up & share front-end knowledge. Agenda on their first meet-up 17.30 – Meet and greet 17.45 – First part - why upfront? the mighty journey from web pages to web apps - html & frontend developer tools, learning resources - css frameworks - javascript frameworks, why so many? which kind of problems do they solve? - frontend and mobile with native wrappers, pushing beyond the browser limits 18.30 – Pizza and beer break 19.00 – Second part - why ReactJS? structuring up for enterprise frontend projects - run the pure UI todo list - meet Flux, implement an actions oriented structure - persist data with FireBase (frontend oriented data storage solution from google) - package your app for deploying I you like this, we set a recurring FrontBox night – future topics can be: - packaging assets for the web (Browserify, WebPack) - quality automation: unit testing in the browser (karma, mocha chai, sinon) - quality automation: functional testing in Javascript with Selenium and WebDriver - meet canvas for high performance rendering - meet CSS Animations - meet KnockoutJS for a simple yet powerful two way binding library - writing a jQuery plugin the right way - browser performances: how to use the developer tools for detecting memory leaks, rendering issues and so on Event sponsor THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: DevOps with Docker + Money and Currency API
subTitle: Javaforum
description: Welcome to Javaforum Malmö All presentations will be given in english. 17:30 Pizza and beer 18:00 Docker, the Future of DevOps What is Docker and why should you care? A Docker container is like a lightweight Virtual Machine. It gives you the benefits of a virtual machine, isolation of your application, without the drawbacks, having to ship an entire operating system with your application, slow startup time, and difficult interaction with the host. In this presentation you will learn why Docker and containerization is the future of DevOps and how to use it efficiently. You will learn how to build, run, and link containers, and what volumes are and what they are used for. You will also learn about some of the many orchestration solutions that exists for managing a cluster of containers, both locally and in the cloud. Speaker: Anders Janmyr Anders is a programmer since 20 years. He loves programming, but also talking and writing about it. He has a wide experience of programming languages and has worked with frontend, backend, databases and embedded systems. The last years he is doing mainly web development in Ruby and Javascript. When he is not programming he enjoys slacklining, skiing, walking his dogs, and reading. 19:00 Short break 19:10 Money and Currency API Money is an important part of many domains with some non-obvious complexities. Despite that there is no standard way of handling those issues in Java. In this talk we will look at JSR 354, Money & Currency API, and it's reference implementation Moneta that try to redress this issue. Speaker: Pavel Rozenblioum Pavel is a Senior Java Developer at Jayway. Prior to that he spent 7 years working as a Java EE developer at Tetra Pak. Event sponsor

title: Theme: SECURITY in IoT
subTitle: Internet of Things Malmö
description: Second Meetup for IoT Malmö and Skåne region! Lots of potential and interesting developments here in Skåne in the areas of Cloud, Mobile and the Internet of Things. Our first meet and greet will include presentations, discussions and opportunities to mingle with the passionate people who will design, implement and use our future connected devices What are the security aspects of implementing a IoT solution? Where and by who will all of these new systems be used, and for what purposes, other than the "first" use case? The recent news of hacks of SIM-card manufacturer Gemalto and other base level firmware has led to an interesting discussion and awareness online of how secure our new devices are and needs to be going forward. As Johan Strömhage, CEO of Purple Scout, said at the first meetup; there will probably be one or two major crashes regarding IoT before we get things right. IoT Security will definitely be one of those things. We hope to get a good discussion going around the ethical/human side of IoT Security, as well as implementations (and lessons learned) from the industry. Schedule 17:30 Doors open, mingle, grab some drinks and snacks 18:00 First speaker – Henrik Cosmo, Project Leader for the Minimum Viable Device Project at Mobile Heights, Lund. Intro pitch and registration advice to Mobile Heights IoT hackathon on 10-12th April! The MVD will be a hardware+software gateway for sensors to send and receive data from the Cloud (or other network). What new and innovative things can students, professionals, hobbyists, tinkers and hackers create over a hackathon weekend? 18:30 Break and drinks 18:45 Second speaker – Laura Kivimägi, previously working with Business Analytics & Optimization at IBM, currently studying computer informatics technology at Lund University. A regular citizen's view of IoT security aspects and how it relates to cross-functional knowledge of technology and other areas not ordinarily associated with IoT. Laura's involvement on a professional and personal level will give food for thoughts about what we need to consider when we look at the "abusive" side of IoT. 19:15+ Presentations end. Networking, discussions, mingling. Tips • Bring your ideas for upcoming meetup discussion theme • Bring business cards OR be very cutting edge and bring a QR-code for LinkedIn or contact details. Event sponsor THIS EVENT IS FULLY BOOKED

title: Ditt system ÄR kapat (IT-säkerhet från skyttegraven)
subTitle: Frukostseminarie
description: Det finns två typer av företag, de som vet att de blivit hackade och de som ännu inte vet om det. Många vet inte och tråkigt nog så har 70% av alla hemsidor, intranät och system sårbarheter som kan utnyttjas av inkräktare för att komma över känslig information. Oavsett om det är en stor eller liten hemsida, ett intranät eller system så kan det vara förödande om den överkomna informationen sprids till fel personer. Förvänta er en genomgång från övergripande nivå ner till konkreta exempel på hur du påverkas i din vardag, i mailkonversationer och webbapplikationer. Presentationen riktar sig till personer med intresse för webben och som är nyfikna på hur angrepp kan se ut i konkreta fall. Du kommer att förvånas över att det är så pass utbrett men också att det är relativt enkelt att upptäcka. För att stilla panikkänslan som kan dyka upp efter att ha gått i genom säkerhetslistan OWASP Top 10, lovar Oscar att avsluta med handgripliga tips på hur du själv kan undvika de mest basala misstagen vad gäller IT-säkerhet på webben. Oscar Andersson arbetar idag med utveckling och IT-säkerhet på Cybercom och har tidigare jobbat med penetrationstest av webbapplikationer på Digifort i Lund. I egenskap av entreprenör driver han egna webbshopar där insikten i OWASP och IT-säkerhet har förhindrat många intrång.

title: Building Microservices by Sam Newman
subTitle: Book Club
description: What’s not to love about a Book Club? It's the perfect opportunity to exchange ideas and share knowledge with others. We're kicking off this initiative by reading the newly released "Building Microservices" by Sam Newman. About the book "Building Microservices -Designing Fine-Grained Systems" "Distributed systems have become more fine-grained in the past 10 years, shifting from code-heavy monolithic applications to smaller, self-contained microservices. But developing these systems brings its own set of headaches. With lots of examples and practical advice, this book takes a holistic view of the topics that system architects and administrators must consider when building, managing, and evolving microservice architectures." Read more about the title here: http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920033158.do How does it work? The first meet-up will be an introduction to both the club and the book. We’ll go through how the future meetings will be laid out whilst getting to know each other. Every attendee will receive a copy of the book \o/ Building Microservices touches on a wide range of subjects, and will certainly provide us with much food for thought around several topics concerning software architecture. We’re hoping for some very interesting discussions. Where The first meeting will be held at Foo Café on Monday the 23rd of March at 1730, after which we’ll meet up again a bit further down the line (every 6 weeks or so). 1730-2000 (food and drink will be provided) Sign-up, come along and get reading! Book Club is sponsored and facilitated by

title: En halvdag med ITSM och ledarskap
subTitle: itSMF Sweden
description: Som en fortsättning på vår heldagsaktivitet i November arrangerar vi en halvdag den 23 April, som självklart kommer att handlar om IT Service Management, men även ledarskap. Program: 08:00-8:30 Morgonmingel och uppstart 08:30-9:25 Situationsanpassat ledarskap Talare: Niclas Carlnén, Malmö FF 09:25-9:30 Bensträckare 09:30-10:15 Vet din beställare vad du gör? Talare: Ulf Santesson, IT Informa 10:15-10:40 Mingel och nätverkande 10:40-11:25 Från teknik- till tjänsteorienterad leverantör Talare: Evalotta Elnertz & Josefina Eliasson, Lunds kommun 11:25-11:30 Bensträckare 11:30-12:15 Implementation of Service Portfolio Management Talare: Nelli Serifovski, NNIT 12:15 Avslutningsmingel Eventsponsor DETTA EVENTET ÄR FULLBOKAT Anmälan till väntelista mejla Joacim Lindman

title: Because one learns more from failure than success
subTitle: FuckUp Nights
description: What is FuckUp Nights A monthly event series where fuckupreneurs talk about their biggest professional or business failure in an irreverent and candid way.   It started as a hobby in Mexico City and went out of control to be replicated all around the world. FuckUp Nights is already present in 64 cities and 25 countries around the Globe including Copenhagen, Stockholm and Malmö. Why We Do It · Because one learns more from failure than success. · Because we were fed up with simplistic and unrealistic stories of overnight success. · Because the first time we did it our lives were changed, and we want to share the experience with you. How In each FuckUp Night 3 or 4 fuckupreneurs share their stories of failure including: • What was their project? • What did they do wrong? • What did they learn? • What would they do differently? At the end of each story the audience asks questions. All accompanied by beer and good friends. Facebook page “Failure sucks but instructs” Event sponsor

title: TDD practice session
subTitle: ØSCG meetup
description: ØSCG is continuing to try and expand our knowledge of, and experience with, Test Driven Development (TDD). Our monthly TDD practice session is an effort to achieve this goal and strengthen not only our skills but also our community. Pavel Rozenblioum will be the guide for the evening as we go through one (or perhaps more depending on how we fare) Katas. We will work in pairs and use cyber-dojo [http://cyber-dojo.org] as our environment. Since this is a practice session that involves hands-on work it is preferable if each participant has their own laptop, however we will be working in pairs so if you do not have a laptop to bring then please don't be discouraged. If you have any questions about how it works prior to the event please do not hesitate to send us a mail at our Google Group or a message at our LinkedIn group.

title: Tech-Talker course
subTitle: MasterClass
description: THIS COURSE IS CANCELLED When: Every Tuesday evening from 14 April to 26 May, 2015 except 28 April. There are six sessions in total. Conducted by: Shu Liang, talk&awe Cost: Regular price 9.800 SEK / attendee excluding VAT (max 10 attendees) Including documentation and food/beverage at each session. About the course A seminar-style workshop that develops your public speaking skills for the benefit of work efficiency and interpersonal communication - something that you and your company/employees would benefit from! The fundamentals of public speaking will be presented in a relaxed and interactive atmosphere. In addition to learning, participants will get to prepare and deliver at least three speeches in front of the other participants. Course curriculum: #1 - Introducing the elements #2 - Clarity with structure #3 - Are you content with your content? #4 - Amplifying through delivery #5 - The art of effective feedback #6 - Keynote presentation tips and tricks Course Testimonials from earlier participants: "The course held a very high and even level in all aspects." "Shu is very inspiring as an instructor and I felt that she genuinely cared and wanted us to improve." About Shu Liang Shu Liang has achieved the Distinguished Toastmaster (DTM) award. She has extensive work experience as an IT project manager in Canada and the Middle East in energy, construction and banking fields. Shu was recently on the jury panel at the Øredev Speakers Challenge at the Foo Cafe. Her speaking signature is energy, focus and motivation. talk&awe empower participants to deliver confident and impactful presentations to their audience. Based in the Öresund region, we lead participants through positive and fun learning experiences ranging from presentations to interactions and hands-on practice. http://talkandawe.com Your audience is ready. Are you? Please send an email to carina@foocafe.org to get more information or if you would like to pay the course through an invoice.
